Los sueños más grandes de Yesenia son tener otro trabajo mejor, seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria especializada en profesorado, también desea casarse con su esposo y tener otro hijo y remodelar su vivienda para vivir más cómodamente con su esposo y su hijo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 20 years old. She studied through the ninth grade. She says that the financial resources of her family did not allow her to continue her education. She has a life partner. Her partner works as a reader for a business and grows corn and beans. They are the parents of a three year old son.

Yesenia is dedicated to giving literacy classes to older people. She comments that she has already been doing this for two years and that it is something that she likes very much, teaching people to read and write who did not have the opportunity to study. She obtained this work thanks to a friend who recommended her so she could work and now she is an excellent employee all because of her dedication and commitment to the work she does. She works in the afternoons from 3:00PM until 5:00PM. Yemeni also does the household chores at home and cares for her son in her free time.

She is asking for a loan to prepare the soil, pay labor and to buy fertilizers in order to grow beans. This work is done by her partner and they store some of the harvest for food and sell the rest.

Yesenia’s greatest dreams are to have a better job and to study for a university degree to become a teacher. She also wants to marry her partner and have another child, remodel her house, and live more comfortably with her husband and son.

loans.use: to prepare the land, pay for labor, and buy fertilizer to grow beans

loans.name: Dúo Flores Del Molino Group

texts.es:
Dúo Flores Del Molino
Formado por María Balvina originaria de la aldea el molina san Martin Jilotepeque, María balvina se dedica a la crianza de pollos y marranos Solicita el crédito para invertir más en su negocios de crianza de animales y así cuando ya estan grandes venderlos. Agradece a la institución por ayudar a gente con ganas de sobresalir y que necesitan el apoyo económico para cumplir sus sueños.total mente agradecidos don Kiva.
texts.en:
The Dúo Flores Del Molino Group was formed by María Balvina who is originally from the village El Molina, San Martin Jilotepeque. 

María Balvina works works raising chickens and pigs. She is asking for a loan to invest in her businesses of raising animals and selling them when they grow. 

She is grateful to the institution for helping people who want to succeed and who need the financial support to meet their dreams. She is totally grateful for Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, da un mejor servicio a sus clientes, tiene más ingresos que utiliza para cancelar su deuda y mejorar el estilo de vida de sus hijos, los cambios positivos que tiene en l actualidad es el resultado de la buena administración del crédito anterior.
 Para mantener la venta de pupusas y bebidas funcionando se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar bebidas, quesillo, aderezos, arroz, aceite y chicharrón, así podrá seguir teniendo un negocio rentable y con buen servicio.
texts.en:
As a result of the good management of her previous loan Martha gives better service to her customers, and has more income which she uses to pay off her debt and improve the life of her children. These are changes for the better which she currently experiences.

Martha has now decided to seek a new loan so she can continue her work selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and drinks. She wishes to buy drinks, cream cheese, salad dressings, rice, oil, and pork rind crackling so she can continue having a profitable business and providing good service.

loans.use: buy drinks, cream cheese, salad dressings, rice, oil, and pork rind crackling

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира 47-летняя деятельная женщина из северного города Конибодом. Она в течение 10 лет занимается садоводством и растениеводством. У нее имеется 1 га участка земли, на котором она сеет корм для скотов для продажи, а на части ее земли растут плодовые деревья, в частности абрикос. Муж Замиры в течение 15 лет работает руководителем Центра социальной защиты населения. У Замиры двое сыновей, которых зовут Алишер и Шероз. Шероз является студентом. Он учится заочно во втором курсе Института экономики и торговли по специальности "Экономическая информатика". Годовой контракт за учебу составляет 630 долларов США. Замира сейчас хочет оплатить за двухлетнее обучение сына в институте. Она накопила немного сбережения и ей не хватает еще 1000 долларов. Эту сумму Замира просит в кредит. Она полагается на финансовую поддержку и верит, что благодаря вашей помощи ее сын сможет продолжить учебу в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
Zamira is an active and energetic 47 year old woman from the northern city of Konibodom. For 10 years she has been in the farming business.   She has 1 ha of land where she grows cattle fodder to sell.  On a part of her land she has fruit trees, primarily apricot.  For 15 years Zamira's husband has been the director of the Center for Social Protection.  Zamira has two sons, Alisher and Sheroz.  Sheroz is in his second year of studying economic informatics in an extension course at the Institute of Economics and Trade.

Sheroz's yearly tuition is $630 (USD) and Zamira would like to pay for his two years of study.  She has put away some savings, but she still needs $1,000 (USD).  Zamira is requesting a loan for this amount.  She is relying on your financial support and she believes that with your help, her son will be able to continue his studies in an institute of higher education.

loans.use: to pay two years of tuition for her son

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a businesswoman from Liloy. She is 32 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Thelma is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any record of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Thelma continues to look for better business opportinuites, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and consumable items.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. De 55 años de edad soltero con 6 hijos que sustentar y 3 de ellos ya tienen familias apartes y 3 son estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que Santos realiza es la siembra de maíz para luego venderlas por quintales en el mercado de su comunidad, para poder obtener un ingreso económico par el y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 5 años y sí deja muy buena ganancia para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que el le dará el crédito es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos e orgánicos ya que por medio de ello el puede obtener cosechas de la mejor y así tener mejores ventas en la comunidad donde el la vede. Una de las grandes aspiraciones de Santos es la siembra de 5 cuerdas de milpa para poder realizar ventas muchas más grandes con las que ahora realiza y tener un ingreso económico para la reparación de su casa.
texts.en:
The earth has always been blessed by hands that enjoy working and caring for the soil. It is a task that should be admired; it is work that men dedicate themselves to for years and even their whole lives. The land that is not tilled by farmers will not bear fruit for the next generation.

Santos is one such man. He is 55 years old, single, and has six children. Three now live with their own families, and three are students at the local school.  Santos earns his living growing maize which he then sells by the hundredweight in the community market so he can earn money to improve his own and his family's standard of living. 

He will use the loan money to buy chemical and organic fertilizers which will result in an improved harvest. Then he will be able to sell more in the market. One of Santos’s great hopes is to plant five acres with maize so he can sell much more that he does presently. Then he would earn enough to repair his house.

loans.use: buy chemical and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an exotic high quality dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su padre y su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de pilones de café desde hace 6 años y comercializa sus productos con las diferentes agencias de compra de cafe,el joven esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes y controles de plagas para seguir con los cultivos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young man that appears in the photo with his face hidden is 26 years old and lives in his own house with his father and partner. He has made a living cultivating coffee for 6 years and selling his products to different coffee agencies. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and plague controls so that he can keep cultivating and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plague controls.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 21 years old single young man from Deir El balah. He lives with his parents in a humble house. He works in transferring goods in the local market using his rickshaw. He helps his family with part of their expenses and he also pays for his education fees. 

Ibrahim is a student at the university where he studies Mathematics. He would like to find a job in the future as a teacher.

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to do his home work and reports easily.

Ibrahim appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy organic fertilizer for his bananas

loans.name: Xhinete

texts.en:
Xheneta is a married mother of 3 children. She is a house-wife, taking care of the home and her children, while her husband works transporting goods for others. She has always wanted to see her home be beautiful and improve their living conditions but she has never had the chance before. 

For the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to do the flooring in her house and pay for the labor for renovations on her home. This loan will help her to improve the family's living conditions and she knows that without the support of lenders, she would not be able to do this. 

She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to do the flooring in her house and pay for the labor for renovations on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de gallina ponedora, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su familia, la joven está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que ha tenido buenos resultados y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated because she is 26 years old, has worked for a number of years raising laying hens. She sells her product in the nearby areas. With the profits she gets, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her family.  She is asking for another loan to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for the chickens to be able to continue with her work since she has had good results and to, along with her family, have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, ve que su negocio está teniendo mayor demanda de nuevos clientes, por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar arreglos flores, tela para elaborar recuerdos, pegamento, listones, papelería, etc., con los que podrá seguir trabajando en realizar decoraciones para eventos sociales.
 Con la ayuda que le brinda Padecomsm a través de créditos Luis ha mejorado la rentabilidad de su negocio, tiene un nivel de vida mucho más confortable y mantiene una buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Luis sees that his business is having greater demand from new customers.  Because of this, he needs to ask again for a loan in order to buy flower arrangements, fabric for making favors, glue, ribbons, paper supplies, etc.  With these he will be able to keep working making party decorations.

With the help that Padecomsm gives him through loans, Luis has improved the profitability of his business.  He has a much more comfortable quality of life and maintains a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy flower arrangements, fabric, glue, ribbons, paper, etc., to make party decorations.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es:
Guillermo, es panificador, su negocio nació hace 5 años, el producto lo distribuye en las tiendas de la zona en que vive, por el momento no presenta alguna dificultad en administrarlo. Vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 8, 6 y 3 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar para dar una vida digna a su familia.
El capital que don Guillermo está solicitando será de ayuda para comprar harina, huevos, levadura, azúcar, sal, manteca, etc., con estos ingredientes podrá mantener la panadería produciendo, además mantendrá la puntualidad de entrega de sus productos y podrá ampliar su mercado, espera administrar bien el crédito para recuperar la inversión con ganancias que utilizará para cumplir con el pago de la deuda.
Guillermo sueña con ampliar su negocio para contar con los recursos económicos con los que pueda dar a sus hijos un futuro como profesionales y una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a baker; his business was born 5 years ago, and he distributes the product to the stores in the area where he lives. At the moment there is no difficulty in running it. He lives with his wife and three children, ages 8, 6, and 3.  He works in order to give his family a dignified life.

The loan that Guillermo is requesting will be a help to purchase flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, salt, butter, etc.; with these ingredients he will be able to keep his bakery in production.  In addition, he will maintain the timeliness of his product delivery and will be able to expand his market.  He expects to be able manage the loan well to recover the investment with profits that he will use to meet the payments on his debt.

Guillermo dreams of expanding his business to have the economic resources to be able to provide his children with a future as professionals and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, salt, butter, etc.; with these ingredients he will be able to keep his bakery in production.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es una persona muy afortunada porque tiene una familia que siempre ha estado junto a él a pesar de las adversidades, desde muy pequeño ha trabajado en las chacras junto a sus padres y ahora que ya tiene su propia familia con mucho esfuerzo adquirió sus propios terrenos y se dedica al cultivo de cacao, él cree que le está yendo muy bien porque día a día trabaja desde muy temprano y regresa tarde a su casa solo para que su familia pueda gozar de un mayor bienestar.
Eduardo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá compra insumos agrícolas como abono orgánico para sus cultivos, también asumirá los gastos de mantenimiento de terreno, en poco tiempo su producción mejorará y ahorrará su dinero para poder brindarles una educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a very fortunate person because he has a family who has always been with him despite adversities. Since he was very young, he has worked on the farm with his parents and now that he has his own family, with a lot of work, he acquired his own land and works growing cocoa.  He thinks it is going very will because day by day he works from the early morning and returns late to his house just so that his family can enjoy better well-being. 

Eduardo is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have offered him, he will be able to purchase agricultural supplies such as organic manure for his crop, in addition it will take care of the costs of maintaining the land. In a short time, his production will increase and he will save the money to be able to offer his children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure and pay for the maintenance of his cocoa crop.

loans.name: Alicia Esperanza

texts.en:
Alicia, decided to get another loan to continue improving her business. In this opportunity, she will purchase cucumbers, mangos, watermelon, melon, and bags to continue selling chopped fruit and having a source of income.

The utility of her business has been improving little by little with the help of her previous loan. The profits have been invested in improving the family's quality of life and in making the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase cucumbers, mangos, watermelons, melons and bags to continue selling cut fruit and having a source of income.

loans.name: Muharrem

texts.en:
Muharrem is 34 years old and the father of 4 children between the ages of 1 and 7 years old. He is from the Roma community, which is a minority community that is typically poor and has high unemployment rates. Like most women in the community, his wife stays home to take care of the children and the house. Muharrem works as a cleaner in order to earn a living. 

He has always wanted to improve the living conditions of his family as they are very substandard and unhealthy conditions, but he has never had the opportunity due to the lack of income he receives. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to attempt to improve his living conditions and renovate his house. He specifically would like to replace the windows and doors and façade of the house. This will help insulate it better and keep the family warm and dry in the upcoming cold and rainy season. This will help keep them healthy and reduce their costs for heating. 

He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support. He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to replace doors, windows and add insulation to improve his living conditions and renovate his house.

loans.name: Rubis Elmer

texts.es:
Rubís de 39 años de edad, se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería por contratos desde hace 15 años. Se creció con sus padres quienes le formaron y le inculcaron buenos principios los que lo han llevado a ser una persona muy educada y reconocida en su comunidad.

Rubís aprendió los trabajos de construcción de su padre, de esta manera adquirió experiencia y hoy en día  se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos de la cual le sirve para llevar el sustento diario a su familia, la cual está formada por su esposa que se dedica a atender su tienda en casa y sus dos hijos los que están estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, gas propano, detergentes, lejía, etc. para la venta ya que poseen una tienda que la administra su esposa y la clientela le demanda comprar más productos ya que por vivir en una zona muy poblada su negocio está siendo muy rentable. De esta forma obtendrá un mejor ingreso, lo cual le servirá para dar educación a sus hijos y realizar mejoras en su casa.

Las metas que tiene a futuro son las de tener una tienda más amplia y surtida. También, comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladarse y trasladar material  hacia su lugar de trabajo, también apoyar en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rubís, 39 years old, has worked doing bricklaying by contract for the past 15 years. He grew up with his parents, who taught him and instilled good principles which have led him to be a very well-mannered person and known in his community.

Rubís learned the construction trade from his father, and in this way acquired experience and today it has become his principle source of income, which serves him to bring daily sustenance to his family, which consists of his wife, who works running her store in the house, and their two children who are in primary grades at the community school.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase rice, beans, sugar, salt, propane gas, detergent, bleach, etc. to sell since they have a store that his wife runs and customers want to purchase more products, since because they live in a very populated area, their business is very profitable.  In this way he will get more income, which will serve to provide his children with an education and make some improvements on the house. 

The goals he has for the future are to have a larger and more well-stocked store. Also, to purchase a vehicle which will help him get around and transport material to the worksite, also to support his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, salt, propane gas, detergent, bleach, etc. for sale since he has a store that he runs with his wife.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 42 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y  se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar, la señora se creció con sus padres quienes dedicaban a la agricultura y ganadería actividad que realizo toda su vida y le sirvió para llevar el sustento diario a su familia, con el paso del tiempo la señora  comenzó a trabajar en una venta de lácteos, de esta forma ella  adquirió experiencia y monto su propio negocio de venta de lácteos, el cual le ha servido para satisfacer necesidades de su hogar.

Juana tiene una experiencia de 20 años en  la venta de lácteos, siendo aprendida de su madre que fue una señora que dedico toda su vida a su familia y quien le inculco principios y valores morales los que hoy en día la han llevado a ser una buena persona de éxito para su familia y su comunidad, a esta actividad se suma su esposo ya que él trabaja en la compra y venta de ganado.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras, ya que manifiesta que las personas que le proveen de lácteos están teniendo dificultad para abastecer su negocio y por ello, realizara la compra de dos vacas lecheras de esta forma también ella tendrá un mejor ingreso y reformara su negocio.  

Los planes que la señora tiene para un futuro son los de apoyar en la educación de su hijo, hasta que sean unos profesionales y haber terminado de pagar el crédito y hacer una nueva solicitud para la ampliación del negocio, ya que pretende poner un nuevo negocio en una comunidad vecina, también pretende comprar un vehículo para el traslado de concentrado para el ganado.
texts.en:
Juana, age 42, is the mother of two children.  She works doing the household chores for her home.  She grew up with her parents, who worked in agriculture and livestock, something that she has done all her life.  It has served her well in providing for her family’s daily needs.  With the passage of time, she began to work selling dairy products.  In this way, she gained experience and began her own dairy product business, which has served her well in taking care of her household’s needs.  Her husband joins her in this work because his job is buying and selling cattle.

Juana has twenty years’ experience selling dairy products, having learned from her mother, who was a woman who worked all her life for her family and who instilled principles and moral values in Juana.  These have lead her to be a good and successful person for her family and her community. 

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of two milk cows, because the people who provide her with dairy products are having difficulty keeping her store stocked and so, by purchasing two milk cows, she can also have an improved income and rebuild her business.

The plans that she has for the future include supporting her children’s education until they become professionals.  Upon having paid off her loan and having made a new request in order to expand her business (she plans to make a new business in a neighboring community), she also plans to buy a vehicle in order to carry the cattle feed.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows

loans.name: Dúo Concepcion Group

texts.es: El dúo concepción está formado por doña María Luisa quien es la líder del grupo y se dedica a la venta de tortillas (Tortillería) y leña en un pequeño local cerca donde vive y tiene 6 años vendiendo tortillas, ella solicita su crédito para la compra de insumos (maíz, leña, cal, etc.) ya que es más económico para ella comprarlo por mayor y lograr ahorrar y tener mejores ganancias en su negocio, su meta a corto plazo es poder apertura otro local en donde pueda vender leña ya tiene una gran demanda porque no hay ventas cerca del área y sus clientes la buscan demasiado.
texts.en: The “Dúo Concepción” (Idea Pair) group includes María Luisa, who is the leader of the group and sells tortillas and firewood in a small location near where she lives. She has 6 years of experience selling tortillas. She requests a loan to buy supplies (e.g., corn, firewood, lime), since it is more economical for her to buy those things wholesale, to save more, and to have better earnings for her business. Her short-term goal is to be able to open another location in which she can sell firewood. She has a large demand because there aren’t any sellers near the area, and her clients look for firewood a great deal.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Leonarda, la socia sigue dedicándose a la ganadería yy a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Leonarda solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca y alimentos.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower is Leonarda.  She continues working in animal husbandry and raising small animals. She raises these animals to later sell them to her customers who request them, and this is the way that she gets her family ahead.

Leonarda asks for a loan to purchase a cow and feed.

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her business and promises to meet the payments.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and feed.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Juana Maria  se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Maria works in a clothing sales business.  She sells pants, tops, and polo shirts.  She has been in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a shop.  She is asking for this loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and tops.

She is happy because of the loan and is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and tops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase two small sheep.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Ha trabajado la albañilería por un tiempo y hace 3 años decidió por poner su propio negocio que le genere mas ingresos para su hogar y junto a su esposa establecieron una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 21,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio y le genere mas ingresos, va comprar arroz, refrescos, frijoles, harina de maíz, manteca, pan, huevos, condimentos, cereales, productos enlatados, pastas, y carnes. Espera administrarlo bien y enseñarle a su hijo a trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 38-year old man who lives with his wife and son in a village of the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. He has worked as a builder for some time and 3 years ago he decided to start his own business, which would generate more income for his family. Together with his wife, he opened a grocery store, where they sell basic products. 

He is requesting a loan of 21,000 lempiras to stock his business and generate more income. He plans to buy rice, sodas, beans, corn flour, butter, eggs, condiments, cereals, cans, pasta and meat. He expects to manage it wisely and to teach his son to work to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn flour, sodas, butter, bread, eggs, condiments, cereals, cans, pasta and meat.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 28 years old and married with no children. He supports his siblings by paying for their school fees. He is engaged in a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for eight years now.

Alex will be using this loan to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle so that it can be in good condition. He will use the anticipated profits to save and buy another motorcycle.

This is Alex's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to grow his business and be financially independent.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es:
Oscar, es un joven soltero que vive con su mamá y sus hermanos, la familia depende económicamente de Oscar; su actividad económica principal es la venta de frutas y verduras, pero ofrece a sus clientes algunos productos de la canasta básica para tener ingresos extras, atiende su negocio de cinco de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar diversidad de flores naturales, ofrecerá a sus clientes esté producto para la temporada de octubre y noviembre, ya que en esta época en el país se acostumbra visitar los cementerios y enflorar las tumbas, espera tener ingresos extras para cancelar su deuda y mantener el apoyo a su familia.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando para lograr abrir un nuevo punto de venta y así tener un mejor futuro junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is a single young man who lives with his mother and his siblings. The family depends economically on Oscar. His primary economic activity is selling fruits and vegetables but he offers his customers some basic pantry items to have extra income. He works in his business from five in the morning to five in the afternoon.

He will use the loan to purchase a variety of natural flowers, he will offer this product to his customers for the season of October and November since during this time in his country, people visit cemeteries and decorate the graves with flowers. He hopes to have extra income to pay off his debt and continue supporting his family.

His dreams are to continue working to manage to open another sales location and, in turn, to have a better future with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of natural flowers, and offer them to his customers for the season of October and November.

loans.name: Wassomagni Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe WASSOMAGNI ont en moyenne 45ans, 4enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits cosmétiques, des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe WASSOMAGNI sont à leur 7èmeprêt solidaire.FATOUMATA, femme assise au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter10Kgs de farine de blé, 15Kgs de sucre, 10 boîtes de lait concentré, 1 carton de vinaigre et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Wassomagni" group are on average 45 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended households in Yangasso/Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
These women know each other through family connections, and run businesses buying and selling cosmetics, cereals, condiments, and various items.
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Wassomagni group are on their seventh group loan. Fatoumata, the woman sitting in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 10 kg of wheat flour, 15 kg of sugar, 10 cans of condensed milk, 1 carton of vinegar, and 1 packet of Maggi cubes. She gets her supplies locally from the wholesalers. She makes her sales to a clientele composed of women and men, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used for health, food, clothing, and educational expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy various items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron and sheets, so that he will have raw materials to do the work his clients have requested.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products, cold cuts, drinks, bread, propane gas, and snacks for her store, and to buy some pigs to raise.

loans.name: Ivica

texts.en: Ivica, who works as a teacher, is the married father of one child. He lives with his family in one of the minority communities of Kosovo, and like all of the families in his community, they live in very poor and substandard conditions. Their house is very old and has never had any renovations or repairs completed on it. His toilet is in very urgent need of repair and is unsanitary and unhealthy for use. This loan will help his family to have a better living environment with healthier and cleaner conditions for his family. He promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To repair his toilet

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA ont en moyenne 41ans, 5enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DJELI/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des boissons, du savon, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur 6èmeprêt solidaire.TATOU, 1èrefemmeassise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter15 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Djiguiya" group are on average 41 years old with five children, and all live in traditional extended households in Djeli/Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
These women know each other through family connections, and run businesses buying and selling drinks, soap, cereals, and condiments.
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Djiguiya group are on their sixth group loan. Tatou, the woman sitting all the way on the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 15 boxes of soap. She gets her supplies in San from the wholesalers. She makes her sales to a clientele comprising women and men, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used for health, food, clothing, and educational expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace algunos años a la siembra de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en en los diferentes agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, vive en con su madre en casa propia, la joven esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia para continuar con su unica fuente trabajo que es la siembra
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated because she is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area, has worked for some years growing corn. When her harvest is ready, she sells it to the various agencies that trade in basic grains. She lives with her mother in their own house. She is asking for the loan to be able to purchase necessary agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and improve the land that is shown in the photograph to continue with her only source of work which is cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne 48 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DJELI/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 6ème prêt solidaire. SALI, 1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10Kgs de mil, 10Kgs de fonio, 5Kgs de farine de blé, 40Kgs de riz, 10Kgs de sucre, 10Kgs d’oignon, 10Litres d’huile, 5Kgs de Sel, 2Kgs de piment et 1 demi paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Danaya" group are on average 48 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended households in Djeli/Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
These women know each other through family connections, and run businesses buying and selling cereals, condiments, and various items.
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Danaya group are on their sixth group loan. Sali, the woman sitting all the way on the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 10 kg of millet, 10 kg of fonio, 5 kg of wheat flour, 40 kg of rice, 10 kg of sugar, 10 kg of onions, 10 litres of oil, 5 kg of peppers, and 1 half-packet of Maggi cubes. She gets her supplies locally and in the neighbouring towns. She makes her sales to a clientele comprising women and men, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, which will be used for health, food, clothing, and educational expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy cereals and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her location for selling food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida perseveres and always believes she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family. She works hard and courageously manages her farm. Now, Florida requested another loan for the next crop season. She will use the loan for land and seedbed preparation. She wanted to increase her produce inventories, and in the future, she wishes to buy a hauling truck for easy delivery.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Mirjeta

texts.en: Mirjeta is 25 years old and single, living with her entire family. She and her father provide the main source of income for their families, and Mirjeta works from home, making handicrafts and sewing. She is a very talented woman and loves her work very much. Eventually she would like to expand her business, but for now, she is requesting a loan in order purchase a new sewing machine. She is very enthusiastic and optimistic about her future and her business. She is very grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to support her coffee crop in this new season.

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr: Ayawovi  un homme de 41ans vit avec sa femme revendeuse et ses enfants de 7 et 3ans à Lomé.  Il est quant à lui  revendeur de riz, activité qu’il exerce depuis 2008. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Ce premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Le profit lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et faire prospérer son activité.
texts.en: Ayawovi is a 41-year-old man living in Lomé with his wife, a retailer, and his children, who are 3 and 7. He is a retailer of rice, which is a business he has been involved in since 2008. To strengthen his business, he is seeking his first loan from WAGES. This first loan will allow him to buy merchandise in order to respond to his customers' needs. The profit will allow him to provide for his family and make his business more prosperous.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Femme de 38ans, Akossiwa est mariée et n’a pas encore d’enfant en charge. Elle est couturière de profession  et a la fin de son apprentissage, il a ouvert un atelier dans lequel  elle répond aux besoins des clients.  Le premier prêt l’aidera à acheter de la machine à coudre. Akossiwa souhaite rénover son atelier  avec le gain tiré des services rendus aux clients.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 38-year-old woman, married with no children yet in her care. She is a dressmaker by training, and at the end of her apprenticeship, she opened a workshop where she responds to her customers' needs. Her first loan will allow her to buy a sewing machine. Akoussiwa hopes to renovate her workshop with the profits drawn from her services for her customers.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel is 34 years old and married with four children aged from two to fifteen. She and her family live in Dulag, Leyte. 

For fifteen years now, Jonabel and her husband have operated a sari-sari business (variety store) and a bakery. While her husband is focusing on the bakery business, she works on the sari-sari store. She is asking for a loan to buy noodles, cooking oil, sugar, chips, butter, flour, and canned goods. They work hard together to make their business a success.

In the future, she hopes to expand her store and bakery so that she can live a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cooking oil, sugar, chips, butter, flour, and canned goods

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. She enjoys taking care of her flowering plants, which has become a source of her income. Little did she know, she was able to improve her family's living condition with a house with good roofing, and support the education of her children. 

For her funding needs, she turns to the cooperative for capital to support her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Rosalie wishes to become the supplier of flowers in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 40 years old, married, and lives at San Esteban with her spouse. They plant and harvest rice to sell.

Raquel hopes to improve their crop production in order to save additional profits. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 46,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in her farming business. This will help improve their crop production. She will be happy to harvest good crops. 

Raquel will save additional revenues to invest in another source of income such as a hog raising business. Raquel hopes to become a successful entrepreneur in their village.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to use in her farming business

loans.name: Maria Nenita

texts.en:
Maria Nenita has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for seven years and she earns well from this business. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the goal of having a better income.

To improve sales, Maria Nenita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 15,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Maria Nenita hopes that her business will continue to cover her everyday needs and she dreams of improving and expanding her store. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nafije

texts.en:
Nafije is a single woman who lives with her entire family in the southern part of Kosovo. 

Nafije is the main source of income as her parents both receive a pension and are retired. Therefore, in order to earn a living, she works as a hairdresser with a low salary. Typically, her salary is only enough to help provide for their daily needs. They live in a small house which is in need of renovations, and she would like to be able to do the repairs so that her family has better living conditions.

For the first time, Nafije is requesting a loan in order to renovate the house. Her goal is to be able to open her own salon and make enough money to improve their conditions even more. She is very grateful for the help and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To renovate her house so that her family has better living conditions

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en: Zahida is a 26-year-old woman, and she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last four years. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of his regular use of it. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So, he is unable to generate any amount of income, and he wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zahida is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 51 years old and has a farm in Mahayag. She lives with her husband and four children. With farming as their primary source of income, she plants corn and beans with her husband.

Erma wants to increase sales. Consequently, she requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Grupo Trabajadores De Chuilajkalquix Group

texts.es:
De 58 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que el realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casado y vive con su esposa con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que el quiere realizar en la vida, el tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad. (Rosalio es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha de la fotografía)	

El trabajo que el realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde el vive, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 10 años, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero y es la actividad que realiza con una hermano por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

El ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Rosalio para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que el le dará al préstamo que el está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicas para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de el es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
At 59 years old Rosalio still has great aspirations to get to know his community and all those who have visited his business that he does with so much effort and dedication. He is married and lives with his wife, He has the desire to excel in life and reach the great dreams that he should realize in this life. He has four children, the first two have their own families and the other two are excellent students in the community school. (Rosalio is the first person from the left in the photo).

The work that he does with so much care is buying and selling traditional clothing, a business he does at his house and in places close to his community. He has been doing this business for 10 years. The other job he does is day labor and it is something he has done with a brother for more than 5 years He does it because it provides an income for the well-being of the family. and improves the economic situation of his family and of his community.

He has been an example for his community and of this a group of women have gotten together with him to start their businesses so that they can be successful and have important incomes. The loan will be used to buy merchandise, traditional clothing to sell around their community. One of his dreams is to have a stall at the market in his community and see that his children become professionals in their lives.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
Since June 30, 2011, William has found pleasure in his farming activities. He is a papaya fruit grower from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, in the Philippines. William busies himself to sufficiently provide the needs of his family, and farming is the ultimate source of income. 

William learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. He tried his luck on doing business by focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. William is a credible member of the Co-op and received several loans without records of default up to this day. Recently, William took another loan amount of 50,000 PHP to pay for seedlings and fertilizer. This will give his farming income a big boost. William looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy papaya fruit seedlings and fertilizer.

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 59 years old, and a resident of Molave, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She joined PMPC in January 2009 and landed at a right place for her needed capital. She is a MIGS (member in good standing) and has been using the programs of PMPC for five years. 

Eva is a farmer who plants corn, and with the support of her husband, she makes her business grow. Now, she is requesting a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to pay for land and seedbed preparation. Eva hopes that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a rural farmer in Eldoret, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. She is a single mother and has been practising mixed farming for the past one year.

On her farm, she grows maize and keeps dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize; and when she is not farming, Judith offers transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her parents, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meagre earnings, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" 

Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Judith formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. 

She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for beautiful), which produces milk daily, which Judith sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Judith.

The money Judith got from selling the milk was adequate to repay a loan. Today, Judith is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage.

With this loan, Judith is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health and a good livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Absalom

texts.en:
Absalom is 41 years old and married. Together with his spouse, they have been blessed with three children. 

Absalom is a mechanic and has been in this business for six years now. He will use this loan to buy spare parts for use in his garage. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his garage and serve more motorists. 

This is Absalom's second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to expand his garage and be successful.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for use at the garage.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia hopes to have another tricycle unit she could use in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steels to renovate the house.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en: Edita is a single young woman who lives with her entire family. Although she is still a student, she also works as a photographer in order to earn a living. She hopes that after she finishes her studies, she will be able to start her own photography business. She works very hard and loves her parents so much that she wants to offer them better living conditions. Edita is requesting a loan in order to replace the doors and windows of her house before the upcoming winter season. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to replace the doors and windows of her house before the upcoming winter season.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is a 40-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children and is a housewife, looking after her family at home. Her husband has been running a small furniture shop in a nearby town. He wants to sell furniture items like sofas, beds, chairs, tables, safe almirahs, etc. He is also a well-trained carpenter, so he himself makes different designed furniture items at his shop. People of the society like his furniture items very much. He sells furniture at very reasonable rates, which is why the number of his customers increases rapidly.

Ramzana's husband is good and experienced in furniture making. So, he made plans to increase his business in the furniture shop. He wants to buy wood for manufacturing furniture items. Therefore his wife, Ramzana, requested a loan from Kiva's Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan. Ramzana is thankful to Kiva lenders also.

loans.use: to buy wood for her husband's furniture-making business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María a pesar que tiene ayuda de sus hijos se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su esposo, ella desde que era joven  le gusto el campo. Ella siempre se dedicó a los oficios del hogar y el lugar donde trabaja le queda a 20 minutos de su casa y se conduce a pie. Su esposo es el que le ayuda en estas  actividades y trabaja de 6 a 12 del mediodía.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz y frijol, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas  y pago de mano de obra. El crédito le ayudara porque podrá aumentar y mejorar las cosechas para que su familia tenga como sobrevivir y el dinero que podía pagar para comprar los granos básicos poder invertirlos en otras necesidades del hogar.


 EL sueño de María es comprar un terreno que le venden cerca de su casa, con el fin de hacer más grande su terreno para poder tener más animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Despite having her children’s help, María works in agriculture alongside her husband.  From a young age, she has liked the countryside. The place where she works is 20 minutes from her home and she commutes on foot.  Her husband is the one who helps her at her job.  She works from 6 a.m. until noon.  

She has always worked doing the household chores. 

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of corn and bean seed, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides, and to pay for labor costs.  The loan will help her because she will be able to increase and improve the harvests so that her family has enough to survive.  The money that she used to pay for household staples can be invested in other household needs.

María’s dream is to buy a piece of land that is being sold near her house, with the goal of increasing her land in order to be able to have more livestock.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seed, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Pasitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASITAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, venta de dulces, venta de choripán, venta de regalos y juguetes, servicio de transporte, tienda de barrio, venta de estuco, venta de material reciclable.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es cliente en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de choripan (refrigerio); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus parientes hace varios años y al contar con un capital que le otorgo su hermana  decide emprende un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de espacio de venta (compra de kiosco) que estará situado en un lugar transitorio de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente comercializará ahí sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es divorciada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group Pasitas will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Paulina is the president. The members run various businesses, including: selling furniture, selling candy, selling choripán (a type of sandwich), selling gifts and toys, offering transportation services, a grocery store, selling plaster, and selling recyclable material.
The loan that they are requesting will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs, including Paulina. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 2 years ago on the invite of an acquaintance who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling cold choripán sandwiches. She tells us that she learned this business from her family some years ago and that her sister gave her the capital so she decided to start her own business.
The loan that she is currently requesting is to buy some sales space (to buy a kiosk) that will be in a busy part of the city of El Alto and later to sell her products. This form of work enables her to generate income to support her family financially as she is divorced and has 3 children.
When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk.

loans.name: Avni

texts.en:
Anvi is married and the father of 2 children, 8 and 11 years old. 

Based on family tradition, he has been involved in the agricultural business for quite some time, keeping calves and chickens that he raises and then sells later for a profit. Currently he has 3 calves and is need of a loan to renovate their stable which has been damaged. He never has had the opportunity to fix the stable and the loan will help him to be able to provide better conditions and more space to purchase and raise additional calves. 

His goal is to open his own business in the future and he hopes to be able to save money for his family and their future.

loans.use: To renovate a stable which has been damaged

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her land and fertilizer her cocoa crops.

loans.name: Ednamie

texts.en:
Ednamie is a single mom who earns a living with her retail store. She resides in Ozamiz City with her child. 

She had to start running a business in order to provide for the needs of her child. Her failures in life have made her stronger now, and she wants to prove that she can make a change. 

She became a member of Gata Daku MPC and has borrowed a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store. She is willing to sacrifice and work hard in order to provide for her child and make a better living.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is not true for Jane, 46, who is based in the Eldoret area of Kenya and is a mother of four lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years. 

She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking Chemiambut (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. 

The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Jane is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ma. Berlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Berlinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Berlinda dreams of expanding her business and of always meeting her family's needs, especially for the education of her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorenzo Agapo

texts.es:
Al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha se encuentra el Cantón del amor un lugar hermoso de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, un lugar en el que se puede descansar y pasar buenos momentos con la familia y amigos.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Agapo un hombre de 59 años es humilde de bajos recursos económicos que se dedica a la agricultura para salir adelante junto a su familia, se dedica a la producción de leche negocio al que le dedica un promedio de 8 a 10 horas por día, del mismo aprendió en su niñez junto con sus padres, el señor Agapo por la falta de recursos no se pudo preparar solo tiene primaria , en la actualidad el lucha duro para apoyar a sus hijos se preparen y no pasen por las necesidades que el paso, el señor Agapo mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 6 hijos el mayor de 28 años y el ultimo de 17 años, la esposa no trabaja le ayuda con el ordeño de las vacas. 
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio en arreglos y ampliación del mismo, con esta inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos, el señor Agapo agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
The canton of Amor is in the northwest of the province of Pichincha and is a beautiful place with a warm and humid climate and full of kind, hardworking people. It's a place where you can relax and pass the time well with your family and friends. 
Agapo lives in this village and has his business there. He is a 59 year old man, humble, and has scarce economic resources. He works as a farmer to get ahead and raise his family. He is a dairy farmer and he works at this business for 8-10 hours a day. He learned this work as a child from his parents. Agapo only had an elementary education, due to a lack of resources. Today, he works hard to support his children and ensure that they don't lack the necessities that he lacked. Agapo has a common-law wife and a strong relationship, and they have 6 children - the oldest is 28 and the youngest is 17. His wife doesn't have employment but she helps him with the cows. 
He will use the loan to better arrange and grow his business. This will enable him to improve the family's income. Agapo is grateful to the Fundacíon Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunities they offer.

loans.use: to better arrange and grow his business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn  is 53 years old with five adult-age children.  

Marilyn personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. 

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 2 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 12,000 for the purchase of new nets, nylon and other fishing accessories. As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize the chance of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. 

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase nets, nylon and other fishing accessories

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a farmer from Mahayag. She grows variety of crops that primarily supports her family. 

Carmelita is thankful to PMPC for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she is taking a loan for the next crop season. She is borrowing an amount for land and seedbed preparation. 

Carmelita perseveres and hopes to purchase land for rice to provide additional income.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is aged 35. She is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband provides a local rural transport facility, in the form of a truck, to the people of his society. He has been running the truck as a loader and cargo transport. He has had his own truck for the last six years. Due to excess and continuous use, it needs some maintenance. So he has decided to repair his truck as soon as possible. But due to lack of finance he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his truck. Therefore, Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his truck. 

Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's truck (vehicle)

loans.name: Jecelita

texts.en:
Jecelita is married and settled for a living in Clarin with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she manages a retail store in order to make a living. From doing this, she was able to support their daily expenditures. 

She became a member of Gata Daku MPC and took a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and some grocery goods for her retail store. 

Jecelita wants to become successful in her business and wants to provide her family a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and some grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Luzmenda

texts.en:
Luzmenda is engaged in the food vending business in Siquijor, Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. 

She has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering orders for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more meat and spices for her food vending business. 

She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open a small eatery at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her food vending  business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a businesswoman from Pagadian City. She is 54 years old and a widow. She has a lot of expertise in selling, and she runs a little sari-sari store through which she earns a small income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Lilia is a fully fledged member of Paglaum MPC and has taken out several loans already. She remains in good standing without record of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Lilia continues to look for better business opportunities, and to prove that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Edelberto

texts.en:
Edelberto is settled in Clarin, where he makes a living with his family. He is a father of five and is striving hard to augment their living. 

He became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2013 and recently borrowed a loan to purchase organic fertilizer. With his farm, Edelberto dreams to become one of the rice suppliers in the market in town. Hoping for a better living, he is assured that with this loan, improving their lives will become possible.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 35-year-old man married to Maureen, who adds additional income to support their children. They are blessed with three children. Martin has been operating a metal shop for a period of 10 years, earning himself an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.
  
Martin was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES. 25,000. He intends to use this amount to buy additional metals to sell to his customers.

Martin plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children, and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success and provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: To buy additional metals to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se la ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el joven esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia.
texts.en: The young man whose face is pixelated in the photo is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area. He has worked as a farmer for some years, specializing in growing corn. He sells his products in the communities around where he lives. He lives in his own house with his extended family. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc and to improve the land that is shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc and to improve the land.

loans.name: Napoleón

texts.es:
Napoleón de 64 años de edad muy trabajador y responsable con buenos principios morales, es muy conocido en su comunidad  por la actividad que realiza por su amabilidad y carisma que lo caracteriza como una excelente persona por su buena educación y servicio a los demás. 

Vive con su familia formada por su esposa que se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar y a administrar una tienda que es de su propiedad además vive con una hija y dos nietos. Él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente, a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz, frijoles y maicillo. Napoleón se creció con su padre y sus abuelos y su nivel educativo es de 9º grado y el motivo por el cual ya no continúo sus estudios fue porque el primer instituto le queda a 30 km de su casa y en aquella época no había trasporte. A medida que trascurrió el tiempo el señor adquirió experiencia y muchos conocimientos sobre la agricultura y es la actividad, que en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, ya que vende casi el 50% de sus cosechas y la demás queda para el consumo de su familia, el lugar de su trabajo le queda a 5 km de su casa y a realizar esta actividad se suma la ayuda de uno de sus hijos.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos parares de llantas, cambios de aceite, entre otras reparaciones a su vehículo y para la preparación de tierra para cultivar  maíz y frijol.
