Las metas que él tiene a futuro son las de ampliar sus parcelas y diversificar sus cultivos, en cuanto a sus hijos y nietos apoyar en todo lo que sea necesario para su preparación y formación académica, ya que manifiesta que uno de sus nietos quiere prepararse y estudiar para veterinario y todo esto lo va lograr con la inversión de sus ganancias el buen manejo de un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
64 year old Napoleón is very hardworking and responsible with good principals. He is very well known in his community for his work, for his kindness, and his charisma. He can be characterized as an excellent person for his good manners and his service to others. 
He lives with his some of his family: his wife (who does the household work and runs a store that she owns), their daughter, and 2 grandchildren. He works as a farmer, growing staple grains: corn, beans, and another grain called maicillo. Napoleón was raised by his parents and grandparents and he went to school through the 9th grade. He didn't study beyond that because the school was 30km from his home and he didn't have transportation at that time. Over time, he has acquired much experience and knowledge about agriculture. Today, agriculture has become his primary source of income as he sells nearly 50% of his harvest and keeps the rest for his family. His land is 5km from his home and he works there with the help of one of his children. 
The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy two pairs of tires and an oil change as well as other repairs for his vehicle and to prepare his land to grow corn and beans. 
His goals for the future are to increase his land and diversify his crops and to ensure that his children and grandchildren have everything they need for their academic preparation - one of his grandchildren wants to study to be a veterinarian and this will depend on him managing the investment of the new loan well.

loans.use: to buy 2 pairs of tires, oil changes, and other repairs for his vehicle and to prepare his land to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Yulita

texts.en:
Yulita signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Yulita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita is a married woman with a 6-year-old dependent. She and her family live in Dulag, Leyte. Normita's husband work as a carpenter. While he works, she tries to help by selling food in the neighborhood such as deep fried bananas and sweet potato in caramelized sugar, pancakes and ginataan (sweetened porridge with coconut milk). 

Normita is asking for a loan to buy bananas, coconut, sugar, sweet potatoes, flour and milk. Her income will be for food and school fees.

In the future, she hope to venture into other business opportunities for a better life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, coconut, sugar, sweet potatoes, flour and milk

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, a 61-year-old woman from the community of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has seven grown children. For forty years now, she has been engaged in selling fresh fish in their village. Rosita is requesting additional capital (a loan) to buy more fish to sell.

She hopes to continue working on her business to earn a living. She wants to earn her living, in order not to depend on her children. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings for her old age.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She also has been operating her own fruits and vegetable stand for years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having better income to provide their children with better education that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Yolanda would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fruits and vegetables. At an amount of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of fruits, veggies and other items needed to expand her inventory. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Yolanda dreams to have her own place for her fruit and vegetable products. She only desires to sustain the needs of her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruit and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Mayda Lizeth

texts.es:
Mayda tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja en un supermercado y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive con ellos en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Puerto Cortes.
Mayda, tiene su propio negocio de venta de mercadería en general, vende sabanas, cremas para el cuerpo y cabello, perfumes de mujer y ropa de segunda mano para caballeros, damas y niños. Su mercadería la vende de manera ambulante en las comunidades vecinas y por pedidos. Ella dedica todo el dia a su negocio. Esta solicitando otro préstamo a ODEF y a Kiva por 23,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de ropa de cama, y ropa intima para damas y caballeros para vender. Su meta es seguir trabajando en el negocio para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante con los gastos del hogar y aumentar su clientela.
texts.en: Mayda is 23 years old, married, and her husband works at a supermarket.  They have a minor son who lives with them in a Puerto Cortes neighborhood.  Mayda has her own business selling general merchandise.  She sells sheets, body and hair creams, ladies’ perfumes, and men’s, women’s, and children’s second hand clothing.  She sells on foot in the nearby communities and on order.  She is asking for another loan for 23,000 through ODEF and Kiva to buy night clothing and intimate apparel for men and women.  Her goal is to continue working in this business so she can help her husband get ahead with the household expenses.  She also wants to increase her number of customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Magdalene, 44 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kapseret, a remote village in Eldoret. She is happily married and is blessed with two adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal business. 

The Eldoret area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Marina has a grocery store. She sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m until 10:00 p.m. She has already worked 8 years in this business and she does very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies. Luz Marina is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, 50, is driven by passion in selling. A married woman in Tudela, she runs a store that is the primary support for her family. She never gets tired of tending her store every day.

Marissa is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations, without records of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan. She will use it to pay for baking ingredients, including sugar, milk, and oil. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for baking ingredients, including sugar, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is a farmer. His main source of income comes from selling harvested rice to traders. He is 44 years old and married. He has four grown-up children. Rodrigo is an experienced farmer but still wants to improve his farming practices. He is now asking for a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos. He will buy fertilizers, molluscicides and herbicides for use in farming. Rodrigo’s rice crops will grow abundantly with the help of these farm inputs. He promises to pay back his loan in full and continue achieving his dream of becoming a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, molluscicides and herbicides for use in farming.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 34 years old. He is a father of three children, ages 1, 7, and 12. He and his family live in Dulag, Leyte. For seven years now, Ruel has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety store) business, along with two other businesses. He also sells balut (boiled, fertilized duck eggs which contain an undeveloped embryo, usually eaten with salt and vinegar), and he has a vulcanizing shop.

He is asking for a loan. He will use it to buy goods to sell at the store, including chips, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, condiments, and toiletries, as well as duck eggs and equipment for his vulcanizing shop. Ruel is optimistic about the future, and he works hard for his family. In the future, he hopes to make all his businesses stable and be able to expand, for his children's future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the variety store, duck eggs, and equipment for the vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita has been raising pigs for many years, and she earns a very good living. In addition, she grows vegetables in her garden to earn extra income. With these activities, she has been able to provide for her family, and her business is doing well.

Her previous loan, which she used to buy piglets, has been repaid successfully. She took a new loan recently, to purchase more piglets and feeding supplies. Her future plan is to build a piggery shelter, where she can keep pigs to raise, as an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and feeding supplies

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a businesswoman from Ozamiz. She is 48 years old and married, and she has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store, earning a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Anecita maintains membership in PMPC in good standing, without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan with which to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Anecita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Patrick, a youthful, 59-year-old "guka" (old man), who is a father to three good-looking children. He is based in Rudati, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. This is an area with high poultry production and consumption. For 15 years Patrick has been actively involved in mixed farming, as a source of income. He has a beautiful and supportive wife, who helps him with farm work and domestic chores. His primary sources of income are milk, crops, and some personal business that he does to make ends meet.

He passionately loves poultry farming, and this can be noticed in how he takes good care of his poultry birds and feeds them. When he was asked what he enjoys about poultry farming, he replied that he enjoys “picking up the eggs every day in the morning.” However, this humble and honest man faces challenges of not meeting the demand for eggs, and not satisfying his ever-increasing client base. That is why he is requesting a loan -- to buy good quality breeds of poultry birds. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for chicken is always high, because it is such a popular meal for so many people. In addition to earning increased profits, Patrick will benefit from poultry manure, which will save him some money that he otherwise would have used to buy fertilizer. With the increased income from selling eggs, poultry meat, and feathers, he will permanently change his living conditions and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds of a high-quality breed

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Agriculture is fundamental to Kenya's economy. But it is much more than an economic activity. Farmers like Dinah, 39, are stewards of Kenya’s countryside and provide the citizens with the option of buying locally-produced food.

Dinah started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 1.6 acres, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines and motorcycles, to help her run the farm. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Dinah is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Dinah will have more space to expand her business output.

The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her five children who are in public schools.

She feels blessed to have the support of her 43-year-old husband, through all her undertakings. Make a $25 loan, and push Dinah's dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to purchase more land for farming

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 46 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, with four of them currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her bar and lodging business. She sells drinks and provides accommodation. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer, soda, wine, and spirits and to buy more bedsheets for the accommodation business. This will help Annet to generate greater profits. She will pay school fees for her children and meet some home basic needs. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to build another bar and turn the first one into a motel. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small business entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beer, soda, wine, and spirits and to buy more bedsheets for her lodging business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, 21, is a single young man who is very hard-working. He has been selling motor spare parts for the past four years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. (KES is Kenyan Shillings.)

He has applied for his first loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan amount to buy more spare parts to sell.

Edwin will use the anticipated profits to save and invest more into his business. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 57 year-old widow who has been blessed with seven children.  Margaret has been operating a fish selling business for a period of ten years earning herself an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Margaret was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 30,000 and intends to use this amount to buy additional fishes to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Margaret plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años y vivir en zona de lato riesgo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras cerca de su casa en zona muy transitada, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, la joven vive en casa propia con sus padres, sus dos hijos y su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para continuar con sus ventas que le dejan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face has been obscured due to the high risk in her zone, sells fruits and vegetables near her house in a much traveled area. For that reason, she has many customers. The young woman lives in her own house with her parents, her two children, and her life's companion.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables at wholesale in order to continue her sales which offer good earnings.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale for her street-vending business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 26 years old and lives in the town of Luwero, in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Richard has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells spare parts.

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts to sell. This will help Richard to generate greater profits and pay his medical bills. Richard hopes that in the future, he will be able to start up a bicycle shop.

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Vergie is 54 years old and is from Dulag, Leyte.  She is married and has ten children, ages 16 to 32.  For 28 years, she has has a food vending business selling pancakes, sauteed vegetables and deep fried banana in caramelized sugar (banana cue). She is asking for a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, vegetables and seasoning. 
She hopes that with her business profits she can improve the lives of her family. In the future, Vergie dreams of making her business more successful by offering a different menu.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, vegetables and seasoning

loans.name: Artisin

texts.en:
Artisin is from Polangyota, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married.  She and her husband have eight children.  PMPC ,where she became an active member in 2010, supported her by providing the capital to start a snack-selling business, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to make promising sales daily in spite of stiff competition from other stores in the area. 

Artisin is now trying to expand her  business and  has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for snack selling.  She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack selling

loans.name: Graciano

texts.es:
El socio Graciano se dedica al negocio de construccion,el socio hace trabajos como pintados de casa y construcciones,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener una tienda de materiales de construccion.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas como pinturas y brochas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Graciano is a builder who paints and builds houses.  He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and has been doing this for five years.  Things are going well for him and his dream is to have a building supply store.  He is asking for this loan to buy tools such as paints and brushes.

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paints and brushes.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is very thankful for the financial help extended to her. She was able to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business through her previous loan. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise  to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Liezel dreams of putting up her own boutique store so that she can improve their general living conditions. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en: Majida is 27 years old, married and has two sons. She has secondary education. She works as a hairstylist at a beauty salon for women. Her family was affected by the last war in Gaza, and her house was destroyed. She has applied for a loan to rebuild the walls of the bathroom and repair the electricity wires. She plans to purchase cement and wires with the money received. She hopes to be able to provide her sons with the best life conditions. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to purchase cement and wires to rebuild the walls of the bathroom and repair the electricity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle taxi to support his family

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a microfinance member of Paglaum in Tudela.  She applied for a loan for the next cropping season in order to purchase fertilizers for her rice production.  Tessie  perseveres and always believes she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertizers for rice production

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Arlyn is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en: Mark Anthony, age 30, operates a motor transport business.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For him to continue his business, he asked for a loan to pay for motor spare parts and accessories. He dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Zepher

texts.en: Zepher is 50 years old.  He is married and has ten children,six of whom attend school. He lives in Kasese -Uganda. He runs a textile shop and has been in that business for ten years.  He gets additional income from farming. Zepher began the business in order to earn a living and become rich. Zepher has a dream of educating his children to university level. He is a hard working man although  faced with a challenge of limited capital. Zepher wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vicent is aged  36 years.  He is married and has four children living in Kasese -Uganda.  He is a cattle keeper dealing in bull fattening.  He also runs a retail shop as additional income.  He has been in that business for eight years.  He started the business with an aim of looking after his children. He needs a loan to buy cows and bulls for fattening.  He has a dream to expand his business.  Vicent is a hardworking man.  However, he is faced with a challenge of seasonal changes.

loans.use: to buy cows and bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Maria Roxana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas. 

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
texts.en: The member Maria Roxana continues to make a living through her clothing sale business. The member sells pants, blouses, and polo shirts. She has been running this business for several years, and she does very well. Her dream is to have a store. The member is requesting a loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Aira

texts.en:
Aira is a 25 year-old woman from Dulag, Leyte. She has a son who is six years old.  Her partner works as a security guard to support them.  Aira, on the other hand, helps by selling food like barbecue, sauteed vegetables and pancakes. This business started three years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy meat, soy sauce, cooking oil and flour.

Aira has high hopes for the future of her her business. And she is motivated to work harder for her child. Any income will be for school fees and healthy meals of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, soy sauce, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is a businesswoman from Caticugan, Siquijor.  She is a 45 years old widow and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Melanie is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she applied for a loan to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Melanie continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is driven by her passionfor selling.  At the age of 74,  she is a widow in Tudela who runs a store that primarily supports for their family. Everyday she never gets tired tending her store. Ester is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations with no records of default. Now she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of ingredients for food vending. Having enough inventories will mean income opportunities.  n the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Burunja

texts.en: Hello world!  Meet Burunja who is 46 and is a very dedicated father who believes in hard work. He is happily married and blessed with two lovely children whom he often refers to as “my pride.” He is based in Chuka, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. For the past 15 years, Burunja has been actively involved in mixed farming. His primary source of income is from milk and crop farming. Burunja passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of his cows “Wanja.”  Milking Wanja is his hobby and feeding his cows makes him very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Burunja. Although this humble man makes a living through selling milk, he faces the challenge of irrigating his farm and providing water to his animals. Chuka is a remote area without piped water or electricity. Since Burunja is from a marginalized community, he is forced to walk long distances to search for water. He typically walks for two hours. Therefore, Burunja is requesting a loan to buy a water tank. Most of the rain water in his area goes to waste and Burunja wants to harvest the water and store it in a water tank. The loan will save Burunja time and allow him to irrigate his farm during dry seasons and increase his productivity. The increase in productivity will translate into more income, which will provide Burunja with financial security. Burunja will also use the stored water for home consumption. Burunja’s dream is to increase his farming activities and provide his children with a proper education. Education is the only way that his children, who are from a marginalized community, can succeed.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 50 years old.  She is married and lives at Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 
Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 9,000PHP to buy additional piglets and feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 32 years old.  He is married and has one child living in Kasese- Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and joined teaching because he used to admire the smartness of teachers.  Julius practices farming, where he gets additional income. 

He dreams of having improved standards of living. He is faced with a challenge of reduced income. Julius wants money to buy bricks for constructing his house.

loans.use: to buy bricks for constructing his house

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor de 24 años de edad, vive aun con su familia de 20 hermanos y la mayoría se han ido de la casa para formar su propio hogar. Sin embargo, unos cuantos hermanos se han quedado para ayudar en las tareas de la casa, ella además de trabajar ha decidido montar su propia tienda.

Ella dice realizar esta labor en una forma remunerada, desde hace unos cinco años ya que de esta manera ella obtiene el dinero necesario para comprar su cosas.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar azúcar, bebidas, artículos del cuidado personal, golosinas, embutidos, yogurt, sal, harina de maíz, etc. para su tienda ya que le están llegando más clientes y hay cosas que ella todavía no ha podido ofrecer y la gente de la comunidad le recomienda vender ciertos productos que muchas veces solo los encuentran en el pueblo más cercano.
Ella planea seguir estudiando en la universidad y prepararse para ser una profesional, ya que hace poco han abierto una universidad muy cerca de su comunidad, por lo que planea seguir trabajando pero también comenzar a estudiar.
texts.en: 24-year-old Flor lives with her family consisting of 20 siblings. The majority have left the house to form their own homes. However, some of the siblings have stayed to help with household chores. In addition to this work, Flor has decided to operate her own store. She has done this work for profit for about 5 years since it lets her obtain the money she needs to buy her things. The loan that she is applying for is for the purchase of sugar, drinks, personal hygiene articles, candies, processed meats, yogurt, salt, corn flour, etc. for her store since more customers are arriving and there are some things she doesn't have to offer them. The people in the community recommend that she sell certain products that they can only find in the closest town. She plans to continue studying in the university and preparing to become a professionals since they just opened a university near her community, so she plans to continue working while also starting to study.

loans.use: to buy sugar, drinks, personal hygiene articles, candies, processed meats, yogurt, salt, corn flour, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Yurisan

texts.es:
La socia Yurisan  se dedica al negocio de alquiler de equipos de sonido, la socia alquila para diferentes eventos como matrimonios, bautizos y cumpleaños, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va  muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de alquiler de equipos de sonidos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar parlantes para los equipos de sonidos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Member Yurisan rents sound systems. The member rents them for different events like weddings, baptisms, and birthdays. The member has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well. The member;s dream is to expand her sound system rental company. The member is applying for a loan to buy speakers for her sound system. The member is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy speakers for sound systems.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, wood, coconut palms, and nails to build a covering and to buy corn, fried pork rind, cheese, oil, salsa, etc. to start selling stuffed corn tortillas.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en un sector de Cofradía, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 7 años de vender mercadería como ser lociones, ganchos, carteras, billeteras, esmalte para uñas y ropa para damas y caballeros. Esta mercadería la vende de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar ropa, calzado y achinería para surtir y vender. esta inversión le ayudara a mantener su negocio para tener solvencia en su hogar. Su meta es construir un local para establecer el negocio en casa.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in Cofradia, Cortes and has been a merchant for seven years and sells things like lotions, hangers, card carriers, wallets, nail polish, and men’s and women’s clothing, shoes, and housewares on foot.  She is asking for this loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy clothing, shoes, and housewares to sell.  This loan will allow her continue her business in order to be able to pay her household expenses.  Her goal is to build a shop so she can set her business up in her home.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Dúo Elim Group

texts.es:
DUO ELIM
Este dúo formado por doña Marta Olivia, de 29 años de edad, ella tiene  2 hijos y desde hace 12 años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, en diferentes caseríos como Sacsuy, Sineyes  y Cerro Alto, nos cuenta que solicita este nuevo crédito para incrementar su mercadería porque ahora tiene varios pedidos por las fiestas patrias, tiene que entregar suéteres, cortes sanjuaneros y por eso necesita comprar.
texts.en:
DUO ELIM

This duo includes 29 year old Marta Olivia.  She has two children and has been selling typical clothing for 12 years in different neighborhoods like, Sacsuy, Sineyes, and Cerro Alto.  She tells us that she is asking for this loan to buy merchandise because now she has various orders to fill.  She has to deliver sweaters, so she needs to make purchases.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support her family. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday, she hopes to open a butcher shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a businesswoman from Tudela. She is 54 years old, married and has expertise in sales. She has a sari-sari (general) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Rosemarie is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Rosemarie continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: A resident of Tudela, Belen earns a living through her gardening activities. She takes good care of her business to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more income, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer for her flowers to sell. Belen hopes to live comfortably with her children and to help them finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her flowers.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, age 65, is widowed and has five children. She has been selling frozen foods and smoked fish in her village for almost eight years and earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her net income on this business usually goes to her savings. Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to request a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase hot dogs, smoked fish, and cured sausages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hot dogs, smoked fish, and cured sausages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad, vive con su abuela en casa propia, el se dedica a la reparación de escapes y radiadores, el taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el joven esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de herramientas así como muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young man, whose image has been pixilated, is 25 years old and lives with his grandmother in his own home.  He repairs exhaust systems and radiators from a workshop in his home and is asking for this loan to buy tools, as shown in the image so he can continue his business and obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Isidra Magdalena

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón muy hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tenemos muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con mucha amabilidad.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Isidra una mujer luchadora de 49 años es casada de esta larga relación tienen 4 hijos el mayor tiene 24 años y la ultima 15 años, el esposo trabaja como licenciado en un colegio del sector, ella tiene un pequeña pizzería aprendió de esta actividad cuando trabajo en este mismo negocio como ayudante, un día el dueño decidió venderlo y ella al ver que era un negocio muy rentable decidió comprarlo, al mismo le dedica un promedio de 8 horas por día, ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos, solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio en arreglos del interior del mismo, con esta nueva inversión su negocio será más atractivo y eso le dará mayor clientela. 
La señora Isidra agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado is a very beautiful county. Its climate in hot and humid and its people are very kind and hardworking. This county is the arrival point for many tourists since its surroundings have lots of hotels where they can relax and be treated kindly. 

Isidra, a hard-working 49-year-old woman, lives and has a business in this country. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 24 and 15 from this long relationship. Her husband works as a teacher in a high school in the area. She has a small pizza shop. She learned a lot from this activity when she worked in the same business as a helper. One day, the owner decided the sell it and she decided to buy it since she knew it was a profitable business and she was dedicated to it. With this new investment, her business will be more attractive and will attract a better clientele. Isidra thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the opportunity that they brought.

loans.use: to invest in her business by renovating the interior of her store.

loans.name: Nedeline

texts.en:
Nedelina is 54 years old and married. She is a resident of Villaramos, Manukan, Za Norte. She earns a living through farming activities.

She has been a member of PMPC for five years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan to pay for fertilizer and pesticides.

Nedelina deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is an 18-year-old single young lady from Nablus. She lives with her parents in a humble house. Her father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Fidaa is a student in the university where she studies Human Sciences, and she would like to find a job in the future as a teacher. She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. She will use her new laptop to write reports and read articles online. 

Fidaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she was able to repay her previous loan.

Erlinda would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. She is requesting an amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and various hanging plants.

In the future, Erlinda wants to grow her business and to create other sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants for her business.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: In 2011, Lucena learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Norte, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her farming activities. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Lucena feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Lucena wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they support 4 children who are 16, 10, 8 and 4 years old. Jane sells groceries as well as cereals, a business she has done for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs 10,000.

Jane has requested her first loan of Kshs 5,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to add a stock of vegetables and cereals to sell.

With the anticipated profits, Jane will be able to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful in business.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Reymark

texts.en: Reymark is 19 years old, single and he is a fourth year college student. He wants to become a criminologist or a law enforcer someday. Due to insufficient funds to sustain his educational needs, he is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay his tuition fees. He hopes to finish his education in order to help lift his family out of their poor living conditions. He is hoping that Kiva lenders will approve his requested loan amount.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 21-year-old single young man from Nablus. He lives with his parents and five brothers in a humble house. His father works in construction where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Mahmoud is a student in the university where he studies Educational Sciences. He would like to find a job in the future to help his family with part of their expenses.

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. Mahmoud will use his new laptop to write reports and read articles online.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Aun Group

texts.en:
Aun is a 55-year-old worker and also a married woman with a child. She lives in a village in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has been a worker since 1999. Her child is a student. Her husband is 55, and a worker. Together, they can earn approximately $12 a day. 

Now Aun would like to request a loan as part of a group of three members, and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family with more hygienic living. In the future, she is going to renovate her house and help her child pursue higher education.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
La socia Ricarda continua a la ganadería y a la producción de lácteos como leche, yogurt, queso, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Ricarda pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y  se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca y alimentos.
texts.en:
Ricarda continues raising livestock and producing milk, yogurt, and cheese.  She sells to her customers who make requests.  She wants to continue working and supporting her family.

Ricarda is a member of the “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” communal bank.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

She is asking for the loan to buy a cow and feed.

loans.use: to buy a down and feed.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and business expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lorena hopes to increase her capital and profit from her business for she desires to sustain the needs of her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 24 years old and lives with his wife and son in Gaza. He has been working as a barber for seven years. He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was partially destroyed, and he would like to repair it. 

For these reasons, he has requested a loan from Ryada to install pipelines, and to rebuild the walls where shooting damaged his home. Ali is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to install pipelines and to rebuild the walls where shooting damaged his home.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Hello world, meet an inspirational smallhold farmer by the name Ruth. Born in 1977 in the Nandi region of Kenya, Ruth has grown up to be a very hardworking and enterprising woman. Her upbringing was not easy but at least she managed to finish her primary education. 

She is currently running a 5.5 acre mixed farm in Sugoi village with the unwavering contribution of her dear 40-year-old husband. She keeps poultry, sheep and dairy cattle that give her eggs, meat and milk to sell. 

Ruth is seeking a loan to purchase land. Since 1996, when she ventured into farming, she has been relying on her husband's farm to run the agribusiness, and still will. However, the business has grown and all the space is totally utilized. With the loan investment, she will acquire additional land to facilitate the growth of her business.

Her financial discipline led her to be appointed the treasurer of Emkwen Group (made up of farmers who save together and use the savings to access and guarantee loans of each member). Returns from the investment will go toward loan repayment, setting up the new land and food for her family. She will also use the money to meet all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Rose. The 49-year-old mother of four is a smallholder farmer based in Tapsagoi village, found in the North Rift region of Kenya. The secondary-educated entrepreneur runs a mixed-farm in where she keeps three fairly-productive dairy cows that produce milk for both consumption and sale.
 
Rose started farming in 1990. She farms on a 4 acre piece of land that belongs to her husband, whose professional activities have very little to do with agriculture. She was doing it for subsistence but recently switched it up for commercial produce. The income she made from this transition greatly improved her income status to enable her to afford her children a better education at standard private schools. Rose has one employee to help her run the farm business when she is attending her day job or doing her side job which involves selling cosmetic products for extra income.

Rose is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter and animal feed. She places more premiums on animal health and nutrition in her dairy business than other factors. Animal feed has a lot to do with the proper composition of the animal products that she sells to her customers. She is seeking this loan to ensure that her animals have the proper feed composition that the animals require. The chaff cutter is handy during feed preparation to ensure that hay is evenly cut into appropriately small pieces that cows will enjoy to ingest and easily digest. 

Returns from this investment will enable Rose to pay for her children's education expenses. She wants nothing but the best foundation for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase chaff cutters and animal feed.

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Sreytoch is 22 years old and is a student at a university. She lives with her parents in Kampot Province of Cambodia. 

Because of a lack of financial support, Sreytoch would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees for three years. This loan will help her graduate and be able to help her family when she gets a job. In the future, she wants to be a math teacher at a high school and also wants to run a small center for teaching mathematics.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa, 50 years old, lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She was blessed with three children. 

Elvisa is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious family member finds herself plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural goods. In need of additional working capital, Elvisa decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested 25,000 PHP to buy farm and garden fertilizer and to pay labor costs for cultivating the land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Elvisa is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all, nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a motor vehicle someday to use for carrying her harvest to the market.

loans.use: to purchase garden and farm fertilizer and pay labor costs for land cultivation.

loans.name: Hastings

texts.en:
Hastings is 40 years old. He is married to Beatrice and together they have been blessed with seven children between the ages of 7 months and 19 years old.

Hastings is in the transportation business, but he also runs a kiosk where he sells household manufactured products. He has done this business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of 7,000 KES.

Hastings has requested his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of 20,000 KES, which he will use to open another kiosk, as well as add stock of household manufactured goods to sell in that kiosk. With the profits from the business, he will be able continually add stock to his kiosk.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to invest in livestock, hence he will soon begin by buying a cow.

loans.use: to open a kiosk and stock it with household manufactured goods for sale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy. She previously accessed a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Daisy also manages a tricycle unit and their farm business. She would like to apply for new loan amounting to PHP 30,000. She will use this loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to meet their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Daisy dreams of becoming more successful in all her endeavors. She wants to have another tricycle unit that she could operate as an additional transportation service. 

Daisy meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a 30-year-old married man who is blessed with five children. He is married to Violet, who adds additional income to support their family. 

Kevin has been operating a butcher shop business for fourteen years, adding an income of KES. 30,000 at the end of every month. He is servicing his third loan of KES 75,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy cows and goats to slaughter and sell meat to his customers on a daily basis.

Kevin plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and open another butcher shop in a nearby town. He hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats to slaughter and sell to his customers.

loans.name: Manush

texts.en:
Manush is 60 years old and she lives with her lovely husband in Kapan, a city in the Syunik. 

She has a medical education but she never worked in that field. For 14 years she worked at the Kapan city’s unit and she served as commander of communications, but now she is retired and she has a very nice and creative hobby for woman; she is doing macramé at her home. She works by order and she makes different accessories for women such as bags, belts, wallets, covers for small and big tables, napkins, also covers for bottles, etc. 

Manush says that she is unbelievably happy with her occupation because she relaxes, enjoys and uses her imagination while working; the results are her works which her customers call masterpieces. Now Manush needs this loan since she wants to buy materials and some special equipment for her creative works.

loans.use: to buy materials and some special equipment for her creative works.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase ready made women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en: Jesica lives with her family at Peñablanca. She is a college student taking up Hotel and Industry Management. She is 19 years old. She is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay tuition and school uniform fees. Jesica believes that lenders will assist her and this will really help her in achieving her dream. It will also help her to become a successful manager someday.

loans.use: to pay tuition and school uniform fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34 years old. She is married to Samwel and is blessed with three children aged 15, 15 and 12 years. 

Elizabeth has been selling clothes for the past seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has applied for her second loan of KES  30,000 from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy a variety of assorted clothes for sale.  
                                                                                          
In the future, Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop. She will use her anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children

loans.use: to buy a variety of assorted clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
This charming and nice lady is 25-year-old Kristine who lives in Tashir, a city in the Lori region. Kristine is a mother of two children, and her husband works at the police station. She graduated from the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute faculty of Methodology of Elementary Classes. It has already been three years that she has worked at the school as a pedagogue. 

Kristine is a very clever and patient specialist, and a kind and caring person. Despite such a short period of working at the school, her pupils like her very much, as she treats them carefully and with love. Kristine also works at home, in a separated room, where she helps and works with some pupils to get ready for their lessons and explain them the themes if something is not clear for them.  

Kristine has requested this loan as she wants to buy a computer and some professional literature for teaching methodology. She is also planning to attend computer courses for being skilled during her work.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature for teaching methodology.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer luchadora, que día a día se esfuerza para sacar a sus hijos adelante porque son el motor en su vida y el mejor regalo que Dios ha podido darle. Con mucho esfuerzo y por iniciativa propia inició su propio negocio de venta de productos de belleza y hoy cree que le está yendo bien por su constante dedicación y la amabilidad con la que trata a sus clientes.
Maria está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar por un tratamiento odontológico para la buena salud de sus dientes, ya que últimamente se ha estado quejando por unos dolores que siente. Así pues, con una buena salud seguirá luchando por el bienestar de su familia, porque para ella lo más importante es que sus hijas se conviertan en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman who works daily to provide for her children because they are the greatest gift that God can give.  She started her own business with great effort, selling beauty products, and she believes that things are going well for her because of her constant dedication and friendliness with which she treats her customers.

Maria is grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support has allowed her to pay for a dental treatment for the health of her teeth since she has had pain there lately.  Now in good health, she will continue to work for her family’s wellbeing because the most important thing for her is for her daughters to become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for dental work.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha lives in the frontier village Azatamut of the Tavush region. Now he lives with his wife, since their two children are already married and they both live separately. Seryozha worked at his city combine as a worker for many years, but since 1994 he has run a fruit and vegetable trading business. 

Seryozha mentions that life in his village is far from being easy, since all the frontier villages of this region have many problems, but still emigration and unemployment dominate among all the others. No matter how hard it is to leave their native villages, people look for better living conditions, which they find abroad, far from their motherland. The state in every way tries to assist people living here by defining fewer taxes on their business, and supporting them in establishing farms and developing agricultural activities. In this manner they encourage all the people, especially the young people, not to leave their villages. 

Seryozha feels happy that he has a chance to have a deal with Kiva with such comfortable credit terms for him. His business he has is managing at the city wholesale market selling tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers, greens, onions, apples, plums, figs, pears, and peaches. He asks a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to enlarge his stall’s assortment of new vegetables and fruits. 

He thanks everyone beforehand and wishes all the best to Kiva and to lenders who do not even know how great, important, and humanitarian their mission is.

loans.use: to enlarge his stall’s assortment of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima lives in the village of Saratovka which is in the Lori region. She is married and has a son (he is running a small business). Her husband works at the municipality.

Rima graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Methodology and Education of Elementary Classes. She already has 28 years of work experience in this field. She started as a teacher and thanks to her devotion and intellect in her work now she is a director of the same school where she started her pedagogical activities.  She also gives lessons at the elementary classes. 

In a separated and comfortable room at her house, Rima helps some pupils of her school to get prepared for their lessons and home tasks, and explains them some themes which are a little bit hard for them to understand during a lesson’s short period of time. Now Rima is asking for this loan since she wants to buy a computer and also professional methodological literature for her teaching activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional methodological literature for her teaching activities.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Margarita works in her grocery store business. She sells basic food items like rice, sugar, milk and biscuits from 8 am until 7 pm. She has run her business for 5 years and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. Margarita is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. She is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello, world! 

Meet Caroline. She lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, renowned for producing long distance elite runners who have broken world records in the Olympics. Caroline is a mother of five, and she has been in an agricultural business for 14 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. Caroline has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Caroline remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Caroline is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of her business least affected by harsh external conditions. A poultry farm is cheaper to run, and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Caroline will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profit. An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Caroline’s economic activity and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 39 years old and is blessed with four children. She is married to Titus, who adds additional income to support their family. Janet has been operating a clothing shop business for four years earning an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Janet was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 30,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy dresses, shirts, blouses, skirt suits, and trouser suits to add to her current stock.

She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shirts, blouses, trousers suits and skirt suits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally is 20 years old, a student at a university. Her major is banking and finance. She lives in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Because she lacks financial support, Phally would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees for three years. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Antehwe Group

texts.en:
This group of three women is part of the "Antehwe Group" and they are selling smoked fish and hair dressing equipment (perming cream, shampoo, conditioner and wigs). The group is made up of members who benefit from good social cohesion as they all live in the same area.

Comfort will use her loan to buy two cartons of fish and firewood, smoke the fish and sell to customers. She buys the fish from the fishermen, smokes them and then resells them. The profits earned are used to improve her family's living conditions and are spent on food, clothing and her grandchildren's education. She is 53 years old and lives with her grandchildren.

The group members will hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish and firewood, for smoking fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Hello world: meet Emily. She is a smallholder farmer based in Kamagut village, which is found in the North Rift region of Kenya. The 24-year-old farmer started in 2012 with a dairy cow and poultry for milk and eggs. As of today, she has also ventured into crop farming both for sale and consumption. She sells her produce at Eldoret which is one of the fastest growing towns in Africa. 

Emily is seeking a loan to venture into banana farming. Growing bananas does not require much effort, but to achieve high yields requires skills, dedication, and proper planting methods. Emily, who has one child, feels she is cut out for it. She has adequate space at the 2 acre farm she owns for this project. She also has 2 employees who are farmers, and they will come in handy to get the banana farm off the ground. 

Returns from this investment will enable Emily to pay for food, which is her highest monthly expense when she is not servicing a loan. She managed to attain a secondary education herself. With your investment, she will make enough income to educate her child and even further her own education if the stars align.

loans.use: to start banana farming

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman lives with his family in Vanadzor, a city in the Lori region. He is married and has a 4-year-old pretty daughter. Arman’s second child will be born very soon. Arman and his wife are very happy and impatient for their second baby to be born.

Arman had no higher education and he is now making up his leeway; he studies at the Vanadzor State Agricultural University faculty of Food Certification and Standardization. For seven years Arman worked at a workshop as a cabinetmaker, but now simultaneously with his education he has a small business. At the rented garage in his city he sells car oils and he alone hardly covers his family's needs with his business income. 

He is asking for a loan of 500,000 AMD since he has some expanses connected with the decoration of their baby’s bedroom, to buy clothes for him and he also needs some money for his wife’s childbirth at the hospital.

loans.use: to decorate their baby’s bedroom, to buy clothes for him and he also needs some money for his wife’s childbirth at the hospital.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es: Luis de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la comercialización de embutidos en las diferentes tiendas, con lo que gana solventas algunos gatos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la de los materiales como: duralitas, polines, piso cerámico, cemento y pago de mano de obra para poner el techo, repellar las paredes y colocar piso cerámico para vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Luis is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion. He works selling sausages in different stores. With what he makes he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He wants to make some improvements on his house but he does not have sufficient capital to do it. So he is requesting a loan for materials like Duralite sheeting, beams, ceramic tiles, cement and to pay for labor to put up a roof, plaster the walls and lay the ceramic flooring in order to live more securely.

loans.use: to buy Duralite sheeting, beams, ceramic flooring, cement and pay for labor.

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
In 2011, Laureta learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Laureta tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Laureta has borrowed another loan to buy two sacks of fertilizers. This will help give her farming income a big boost. 

Laureta looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC, to Helen, came to the rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has requested another loan for the next crop season. She has borrowed a loan for land and seedbed preparation. Helen perseveres and always believes that she will reach her goal to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Paul, one of the most hardworking men on earth. He is 50 years old, very hardworking and a go-getter. He is a proud father of four lovely children. 

Paul hails from Kapsumai, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions, and to survive you must have tough skin; Paul has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past five years. His primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Paul passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows “Tatii” (this is from a person’s name), and whenever he is milking his cow, he feels proud. He is contented with the farming way of life. 

Paul's biggest challenge in farming is irrigating his farm. He is requesting a loan to buy a generator that he will use in pumping water from the river to his farm. Irrigation is used to assist in the growing of agricultural crops, maintenance of landscapes, and re-vegetation of disturbed soils in dry areas and during periods of inadequate rainfall. Through this loan, he will be able to double his crop production, and this will translate to more income. Through the extra income from farming, he will be able to support his family and keep up with his rising family expenses. Paul patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a generator to be used for irrigation.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Vanadzor, a city which is in the Lori region. Anahit is married and she has two sons. Her elder son lives and works abroad, her younger son is in the army. Her husband works as a guard at the church.

Despite having higher pedagogical education and 15 years of work experience in that field, she now runs a clothes trading business at the city's wholesale market. She sells children’s clothes of great assortment and style that one needs: trousers, shirts, dresses, skirts, blouses, jackets, shoes, slippers, etc. She says that she has no lack of customers who find clothes of a higher quality and any fashion they like in her stall.
  
Anahit asks for a loan of 600,000 AMD in order to buy an assortment of new autumn-winter season clothes which are of great demand among her customers now.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of new autumn-winter season clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost and pest control supplies to improve the soil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Lilliane

texts.en:
Lilliane is a 28-year-old woman married to Charles, who adds additional income to support their family's well-being. They are blessed with two children.  Lilliane has been operating a cafe for a period of eight years, earning an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Lilliane is now servicing her fifth loan of 40,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy wheat flour, maize flour, potatoes, sausages and eggs to add to her current stock, which seems to be running out.
