Lilliane plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, potatoes, sausages, wheat flour and maize flour with which to make snacks for her customers.

loans.name: Indatwa Cb Group

texts.en:
Thamar is a group leader, aged 39. She is married with four children between the ages of three years old and 15 years old, and three of her children go to school. The group is called Indatwa, which means “to be proud” in English. The members sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses in order to change their future for the better. 

Thamar sells food stuffs and has been running the business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and beans for resale.

loans.name: Limeng

texts.en:
Limeng is a 20-year-old student at a university and is also a teacher. She teaches at a private school. She lives with her parents in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. 

Being a teacher, Limeng can earn approximately $4 a day. Because of a lack of financial support, she would like to request a loan to pay her fourth year tuition fee. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she is going to find another job that is right for her skills and to have her own house.

loans.use: to pay her fourth year tuition fee.

loans.name: Dúo Mercado Ll Group

texts.es: Dúo Mercado ll este Grupo esta conformado por la señora Juana Flor de Maria de 23 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de Manualidades y visuteria desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas producto para su negocio ya que en la venta de manualidades le a ido bien, como tambien en la venta de visuteria, el sueño de ella es poder tener un negocio mas grande para seguir adelante y formarse un futuro mas prospero.
texts.en:
“Mercado II” is a group that includes Sra. Juana Flor de Maria. She is 23 years old and has been selling handicrafts and trinkets for several years. Juana is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more products for her business. Her handicraft sales business is doing very well, as well as her trinket sales.

Her dream is to have a larger business so that she can continue forward and establish a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and trinkets to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 28-year-old woman married to Charles, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children. Lilian has been operating a retail shop for a period of four years, earning an income of about KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Lilian was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to buy rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and detergents to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Lilian plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and detergents to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es: Nelson, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo  con su pareja y reside en la aldea del Negrito, Yoro. Anteriormente estudiaba y le ayudaba a su padre y hace 8 años se dedicó por  cultivar arroz y es arroz de primera calidad, el cual vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a la institución por 15,000 lempiras para comprar insumos como abonos, insecticidas, fungicidas, también pago de limpieza y aplicación de fertilizantes al cultivo de arroz. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su cosecha. Sus metas son cultivar un área mas de arroz y que su familia tenga siempre lo necesario.
texts.en:
Nelson is 26 years old. He and his partner have a child and reside in the neighborhood of Negrito, Yoro. Nelson previously studied and helped his father, but eight years ago he decided to cultivate rice. His crop is of the highest quality and is sold at the local market.

Nelson is requesting his second loan from ODEF in the amount of 15,000 HNL. He will use the money to buy supplies such as compost, insecticides, and fungicides. He will also pay for labor in order to weed and apply fertilizers on his rice crop. This investment will help to improve his harvest. His goals are to cultivate one more plot of rice and to see that his family always has everything they need.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, and also pay for labor.

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en: Marichel learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her rice production business. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, she feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer for the next crop season. Marichel wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer for the next crop season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a good quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to undergo the procedures to get his driver's license.

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
José solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar unos cerdos, concentrado y equipo para procesar leche. 

José sueña con tener una granja porcina autosostenible y espera también tener su propia fabrica de quesillo y que sea un negocio a nivel familiar donde puedan salir adelante y poder gozar de una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is requesting a new loan to buy some pigs, feed and equipment to process milk. José dreams of having a sustainable pig farm and also hopes to have his own cheese production that is a family run business. He wants to get ahead and be able to enjoy an excellent quality of living.

loans.use: to buy some pigs, feed and equipment to process milk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of stylish, ready-made women's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 63 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. She is a dairy farmer and has been in the farming business for 10 years now. 

She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow and thereby increase her stock of livestock. She will also buy dairy cattle feed. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another dairy cow.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes and dreams are to grow her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Terimbere Cb Group

texts.en: TERIMBERE is a group led by Monique who is 30 years old. The group name means “to go ahead” in English. She has been a group leader for 8 years. She sells foodstuffs and has been selling through her business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and cassava to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Christine, a very hardworking and honest mother who decided that she would be independent and contribute to her community by starting dairy farming in Chuka, Kenya. Deciding what kind of farming she would do was not difficult. “I was brought up with dairy cows raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Christine said. “It is in my blood.” She passionately loves dairy farming and has been practicing it for the past 15 years. She has never regretted starting to farm. 

Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and crop farming. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her take care of her family and she has always yearned to produce more dairy milk. The major challenge she faces is feeding her cows. She is requesting a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device for cutting hay into small pieces before being mixed together with other forage to feed the cattle. Through the loan her cows will be aided in digestion and they will never reject any part of the food. Christine strongly believes that through proper feeding of the cows she will reap more and it will lead to increased milk production which will translate into more sales and a better income. 

Through this loan, Christine’s life is going to change permanently. Because of this high milk production potential, she will save more money to fully repay the loan. She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cows, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. Es el trabajo que realiza Pedro de 69 años soltero y que tiene 5 hijos los 2 primeros son independientes de sus padres y los 3 últimos  son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad donde viven.

La actividad que realiza Pedro todos los días bajo un sol agotador es la agricultura el ha venido realizando dicha actividad durante 30 años, es la actividad que le ha generado ingresos económicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. La cosecha que espera sacar este año  son maíz, frijol y  brócoli para luego venderlo en el mercado de su comunidad.

El uso del préstamo es par la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos y químicos, para poder obtener una muy buena cosecha, para tener un mejor ingreso económico para mejorar aún más las condiciones de vida de su familia y  comunidad. Uno de las más grandes aspiraciones de el es ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales y comprar terreno para dejar un bonito recuerdo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed by hands that like to work it and take care of it. It is a profession that is worthy of admiring the men that dedicate themselves to it for years or for their whole lifetime. The earth without the labor of these farmers working to cultivate it would not produce the fruits that sustain whole generations.

This is the work that Pedro does. He is 69 years old, single and has 5 children. The oldest two are independent and the younger three are excellent students in the school in the community. The work that Pedro does every day under a relentless sun is agriculture. He has been doing this for 30 years. This activity has generated economic income to improve his family's living conditions.

The harvest he expects to reap his year is corn, beans and broccoli which he will later sell in the market of his community. He will use the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to get able to produce a good harvest, and get more economic revenues to further improve the quality of living of his family and community. One of his biggest hopes is to see his children become professionals in different work fields and buy land to leave a memory for his children.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is a 45-year-old working woman. After she married, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and improve their education. 

Naziran has become famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase a variety of fancy cloth. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fancy cloth.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 52-year-old married woman. According to Rehana, she faced many problems during her early married life. Her husband is a laborer. He was not able to cover the expenses for the family alone. 

Some years ago, Rehana took the initiative to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials.  Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 55-year-old, hardworking woman who has seven children. For nine years, she has been providing the service of tailoring in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Abida’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

In her fifth loan cycle, she has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine and some spools of thread and laces. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. She expects a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and some spools of thread and laces.

loans.name: Aabida

texts.en:
Aabida is a 54-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Aabida makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she has requested a loan for 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Aabida wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for five years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. 

She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema is a 58-year-old married woman; she is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a general store for many years. She offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Saleema needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Saleema has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clay pots and vases for resale.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is an ever-smiling rural farmer in Eldoret, Kenya, an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. She is blessed with five children, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past fifteen years. 

On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize, and when she is not farming, Dinah offers transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meager earnings. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" 

Her biggest challenge is drought. The long, dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Dinah formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small, rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for “beautiful”), which produces milk daily, and which Dinah sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Dinah. The money Dinah got from selling the milk was adequate to repay a loan. 

Today, Dinah is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Dinah is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz, age 37, is a married woman and a mother of 2 children. She has been providing the service of flour grinding in her community with the support of her son (also shown in the photo). They know very well the techniques of grinding and have gained 6 years of experience in this field. At this time, they have become famous for providing fine quality flour and earn enough to support the needs of the family members. 

In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Mumtaz contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 45,000 PKR. It would help her to cater to more customers over time which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She wishes to spend part of the profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 47-year-old married woman. For the past five years she has been selling spices that are used in cooking. She purchases red chilies in bulk from wholesale markets and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become well-known in the area for providing good quality spices and earns enough to live a decent life.

Zareena is a responsible mother of six children and would like to earn more to meet the daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf to buy more dried red chilies in bulk. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

Zareena’s aim is to maintain a good quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy more dried red chilies in bulk.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. 

Zubaida requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth for the winter season.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 53 years old and lives with his wife and one child in Gaza. He has been working as a driver for a school bus for ten years. He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed, and he would like to repair it again, but he lost all his property. So, he is trying now to take the first step until he can go back to his normal life. 

For these reasons, he has requested a loan from Ryada to build a ceiling and walls as a start. Then he would like to install pipelines and buy building materials for renovating his home. 

Ibraheem is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to build a ceiling and walls as a start, then install pipelines, and buy building materials for renovating his home.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in Gaza. He has been working as a tailor for ten years. 

He is one of the people affected by the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed and he would like to repair it again, but he lost all his property, so he is trying now to take the first step before he can get back to his normal life. For these reasons, he has requested a loan from Ryada to purchase cement and other building materials, and also pay for the workers to start working at rebuilding. 

Malek is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for workers to start rebuilding his house.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a 46-year-old widow. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

For the past four years Ghulam Fatima has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her home. She buys all kinds of goods from the market to sell and has maintained many clients over the years.

As Ghulam Fatima wants to grow her business, she is applying for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packets of salt, cookies, grains and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima, 31, is married and a responsible mother of three children. She has been running her own beauty parlor for the last seven years. She is passionate about her job and is working hard to meet her family’s day-to-day expenses. She knows makeup and hair styling techniques and is a well-known beautician in her town.

Saima has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a larger number of customers more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy winter clothes for himself and his family.

loans.name: Samiya

texts.en:
Samiya is a 28-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. 

This will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Sundas

texts.en:
Sundas is a 26-year-old married woman who has been running a school for many years. She has a good number of students and is well respected in her community. She is contributing much to her family’s income through her efforts.

In order to accommodate more students in her school, Sundas has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to buy a couple of school benches and chairs along with a new blackboard. She expects more admissions to her school and wants to spend part of the revenues on its expansion.

loans.use: to buy a couple of school benches and chairs along with a new blackboard.

loans.name: G.s Abba Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana Gabriela es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio la venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, sus clientes le visitan en su casa  y los  atiende personalmente a sus clientes
Doña Juana sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su mismo barrio y su negocio le ayuda de gran manera para cubrir sus gastos en el hogar y de igual manera le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida. 
Doña Juana está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de telas, tijeras, encajes, etc. para tener las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo, solicita el préstamo de manera grupal y junto con sus compañeras espera que la inversión que realicen a sus negocios les sea de mucha ayuda y les permita salir adelante en sus negocios y poder seguir apoyando a sus familias.
Doña Juana María se dedica al comercio, su fuente de ingresos proviene de su negocio que es la  venta de tortilla de maíz actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años.
Doña Juana Lucila se dedica a la costura, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años.

Danlí, Honduras – Agosto   2014
texts.en:
Ana Gabriela is an enterprising woman who is devoted to her business selling tortillas, an activity that she's been doing for 2 years.  Her customers visit her in her house, and she tends to them personally.

Juana's main customers are people who live in her neighborhood.  Her business helps her greatly to cover the household expenses, and it has also helps her to improve her living standard.

Juana Lucila is requesting a loan to buy fabric, scissors, lace, etc. so that she can have the tools she needs to continue with her work.  She is requesting her loan through a group loan.  With her fellow group members, she hopes that this investment that they are making in their respective businesses will be very helpful and will enable them to make progress with their businesses and continue to support their families.

Juana Maria is a merchant, and her source of income is her business selling corn tortillas, a business that she has had for 4 years.  Juana Lucila is a dressmaker, an activity that she has been doing for 15 years.

Danlí, Honduras – August   2014

loans.use: to buy fabric, scissors, lace, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as wood, and accessories for making furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and other construction materials

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old, married, and lives in Siquijor, Philippines with her children. 

In order to sustain the needs of the family, she has found ways to attain income through a buy and sell business. It began with selling a few pairs of shoes, sandals, slippers and bags to her neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her have capital for her buy and sell business in May of 2011. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she applies for 8,000 PHP to restock inventory for her buy and sell business. She hopes that her business will continue and hopes to own a space near public market where she can display her dry goods and cater to more customers.

loans.use: to restock inventories of slippers, shoes, sandals and bags for selling

loans.name: Ermira

texts.en: Ermira did well this past summer, according to her; there were enough people who bought fish from her. Her nets are destroyed, and she wants to replace some and repair others. "A loan from lenders, added to their compassion and understanding, will make it possible for me to achieve my goal," Ermira said with a smile.

loans.use: to repair her existing fishing nets and buy new ones

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida has successfully built her business of stitching clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family’s income. 

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of laces, zippers, and ribbons in various colors. This will enable her to meet her customers' demands on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of laces, zippers, and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 26-year-old single young man from a village near Jenin city. He lives alone in a small, simple house. Hisham works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all his needs. He is also a student at the university where he studies accounting. He would like find a better job in the future.

Hisham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Hisham will be able to finish his studies faster and improve his living conditions.

Hisham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina, 58, is a married woman and mother of three children. Some time ago one of her sons (also shown in the photo) bought a van and started a delivery business. His profits are used to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Sakina‘s son needs some financial help to pay for repairs and maintenance costs on the van. Therefore, Sakina has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation for her son to use on the van. She is hopeful that her son’s business will prosper and as a result the family’s living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance costs on her son's delivery van.

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en: Eight years ago Zeddy started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Siongiroi, a remote rural town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes a profit through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit so she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have an easier time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Zeddy believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Zeddy waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 54 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with five children. Alice has been farming for five years now. She grows maize, beans and vegetables. Her spouse provides additional income to support the family.

This is Alice's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. She will put the anticipated profits toward her family's needs. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds of a high-quality breed.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna, is a 44-year-old married woman, and she has five children. 

Amna has been running a business of animal purchase and sales along with her husband for many years. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them at different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. 

In order to expand their earnings, Amna has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy more baby goats for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad who is 26 years old lives in Gaza. He has been working at a private institution. 

Mohammad's family was affected by the last war in Gaza. His house was destroyed, so he would like to help his family to rebuild it. For these reasons, he has requested a loan from Ryada to install pipelines and to rebuild the kitchen and the bathroom in his home. 

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him. Mohammad hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family.

loans.use: to install pipelines and to rebuild the kitchen and the bathroom his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase materials such as flour, eggs, milk, sugar and other things to make delicious sweets in a large amount and sell to the local residents

loans.name: Familia Miranda Group

texts.es:
"Familia Miranda" es un grupo conformado por cuatro personas, todos ellos tienen un gran deseo por mejorar su calidad de vida y de alguna manera asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.

Eduardo tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre con Griselda desde hace 6 años y juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos. Eduardo y su papá se dedicaban a comprar y vender carros, en alguna ocasión uno de sus clientes le recomendó vender ropa y decidió intentarlo. Desde el inicio, tuvo buenas ganancias y continuó invirtiendo poco a poco hasta llegar a los cuatro años de experiencia que hoy en día tiene en el negocio. Eduardo platica que sale a vender en la plazas o tianguis pero también aprovecha los momentos en que gracias a los programas del gobierno, la gente se reúne en ciertos puntos de su localidad. A Eduardo le agrada mucho su actividad porque obtiene buenas ganancias en un periodo muy corto, su inversión la puede recuperar en cuestión de tres días, su dinero siempre está en constante movimiento. 

Eduardo está muy contento y agradecido con KIVA y VisionFund porque con su crédito podrá comprar más mercancía como pantalones, chamarras, sudaderas, playeras, camisas, etc. “Espero seguir así para poder ampliar mi negocio abrir otras sucursales en otros lugares”.

Los integrantes del grupo son Evodio quien invertirá en borregos; Janet, en abarrotes y Griselda, en ropa. 

*En la imagen: Eduardo aparece cargando a su bebé. La foto fue tomada en los arcos del municipio donde habitan los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
Familia Miranda is a group made up of four people who all have a desire to improve their quality of life and assure their children's future.

Eduardo is 26 years old and has been common-law married to Griselda for six years.  Together, they have a family with two children.  Eduardo and his father worked buying and selling cars.  One of their customers recommended that they sell clothing and they decided to try it.  Since the beginning, they have had good profits and have continued to invest little by little until they had four years of experience.  Eduardo goes out to sell in the plazas and street markets, and also takes advantage of the times when people gather at certain points in town thanks to government programs.  Eduardo likes this work very much because he earns good profits in a short time period.  He can recoup his investment in three days and his money is always moving.

Eduardo is very happy and grateful to Kiva and VisionFund because he will be able to buy more merchandise with his loan, including pants, jackets, sweatshirts, t-shirts, and tops.  "I hope to continue like this to be able to expand my business and open other branches in other places."

The group members are Evodio, who will invest in sheep, Janet, who will buy groceries, and Griselda, who will buy clothing.

In the photograph, Eduardo is carrying his baby.  The photo was taken at the arches in the town where the group members live.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing: pants, jackets, sweatshirts, t-shirts, and tops.

location.town: Guarda San Antonio Buenavista, San José del Rincón

loans.name: Marta Concepcion

texts.es: marta de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas, ella posee un negocio de venta de sandalias ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de la mercadería y los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas sandalias por mayor para tener mas variedad y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Marta is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two daughters.  She has had a business selling sandals at the city market for many years.  She has many customers because of the quality of her merchandise and the good prices that she offers.  She is asking for a loan to buy more sandals wholesale in order to offer more variety and therefore make better profits.

loans.use: to buy more sandals wholesale

loans.name: Al- Huda Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Huda. It consists of four women from Mokala, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Huda is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children living with her family in Mokala city, Yemen. Huda has a University education. 

Due to high rates of unemployment in the country, Huda couldn't find a job to look after her family. Now, she works as a housewife and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. The kitchen in Huda's house lacks many appliances. She wants to provide her house with many home appliances for the house. Unfortunately, Huda doesn't have enough money to do that.

For this reason, Huda is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase kitchen appliances for her house. Huda looks forward to purchasing all the home appliances for her house to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase many kitchen appliances for her house.

loans.name: Jose  Domingo

texts.es: Jose 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos, el es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la mecanica de obra de banco (estructuras metalicas) desde hace varios años, Jose solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito para mejorar su vivienda colocando un sistema eléctrico ya que actualmente no cuenta con luz propia y con lo que gana de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita dicho crédito y comprar focos, alambre y pago de mano de obra y asi pueden vivir mas seguros con su familia.
texts.en: Jose, 40 years old, lives in his own house with his family made up of his wife and his two children.  He is a very responsible, hard-working man, who has earned a  living in metalwork (metal structures) for many years. Jose is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to improve their home, installing an electrical system since currently they don't have their own electricity and what he earns at his job is not enough to make it possible.   For that reason, he is asking for the loan to buy lights, wiring and pay for labor and thus be able to live more securely with his family.

loans.use: to buy lights, wiring and labor to install an  electrical system in his home

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al negocio propio venta de electrodomésticos como ser: licuadoras, computadoras portátiles, secadoras de uña, D.V.D, secadoras de pelo, actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año.
Doña Lourdes sus clientes son personas que viven en su mismo municipio también se dedica a la venta de zapatos y de ropa, esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar 2 estantes y también ropa como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, etc. y espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante en su negocio y a su vez que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Lourdes sueña con poder aumentar su negocio y es por eso que solicita el apoyo porque no cuenta con el capital suficiente.   

Danlí, Honduras - Agosto de 2014
texts.en:
Lourdes is an enterprising woman who makes a living through her own business selling appliances such as blenders, laptops, fingernail dryers, DVD players, and hair dryers.  She has had this business for a year.  Her clients are people who live in the same municipality.  She also sells shoes and clothing.  

She is asking for a loan to buy 2 shelving units and clothing such as shirts, dresses, and pants, among other things.  She hopes that this investment will allow her to get ahead in her business and in turn improve the quality of life of her family.  She dreams of growing her business and therefore she is asking for support since she doesn't have enough capital to do this on her own.  

Danlí, Honduras,
August 2014

loans.use: to buy 2 display cabinets as well as shirts, dresses, pants, and other clothing for her business

loans.name: Dinora Xiomara

texts.es: Dinora de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se  dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, tomates, repollos, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dinora is 34 years old and lives in a house she owns with her life partner and their three children.  She has worked selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas].  She has many customers because she offers good prices and she is kind while she sells.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, cheese, chicharrones, beans, tomatoes, and cabbage to continue her work and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cheese, chicharrones, beans, tomatoes, and cabbage.

loans.name: Somia

texts.en:
Somia is 40 years old, married and has five children. She has a secondary education. She works at home as tailor. 

Her family was affected by the last war in Gaza, and her house was partly destroyed. She applied for a loan request to install glass for the house windows and water pipelines for the kitchen from the money received. She hopes to be able to provide her sons with the best life conditions. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her. She hopes to be able to be back to her normal life again with her family, and to provide good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to install glass for the house windows and water pipelines for the kitchen

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Tem 46 anos, vive maritalmente, mãe de 7 filhos maiores e vivendo com alguns, vive à base de negócio e conta com ajuda do esposo pedreiro que por conta própria, vive na casa própria e esta a repetir o crédito  pela segunda  vez .
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar arroz, açúcar,  óleo,  omo, etc para ampliar o seu negocio que faz numa banca no mercadinho da zona onde vive.
Ela gostaria de poder desenvolver mais o seu negocio e adquirir mais bens para o seu lar.
Mas tem como desafio o facto de ter ainda um capital muito reduzido para o seu negocio
texts.en:
Felismina is 46 years old and married. She has seven adult children, some of whom live with her. She earns a living through her business and gets help from her husband, who's a self-employed mason. She lives in a house that she owns. This is her second loan.
With the loan she intends to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, laundry detergent, etc. That way she'll expand the business she runs from a booth at the local market.
She would like to be able to further develop her business and buy more goods for her house.
However, she's challenged by the fact that she still has very little capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, laundry detergent, etc., in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop so her daughter can do schoolwork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit, corn, chickens, vegetables, snacks, drinks, and canned goods to help open a general store.

loans.name: Klarita

texts.en:
Klarita is a 48-year-old married mother of a 21-year-old daughter, Suada, who appears in the photo with Klarita. Suada wants to study law in the neighboring country, Macedonia. Klarita is requesting your financial help to pay for her daughter's university fees. 

Klarita works for pay in a nearby hotel and her husband earns an income in auto service. Kindly note that Klarita and Suada will very much appreciate your understanding. 

A bit about Korce, their city of residence. It is situated in the southeastern part of the country, just at the foot of Morava Mountain. The winter is extremely rough with the snow starting as soon as mid-October and lasting until the end of April and sometimes the end of May. The summer is very cool as well.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university fees (law degree) in Macedonia

loans.name: Safira

texts.pt:
Solteira de 35 anos de idade, mãe de 1 filho com idade escolar e com acesso à escola, vive ainda com os pais, trabalha como cozinheira numa barraca e faz negócio de venda de pão para reforçar os seus rendimentos que correspondem ao salário mínimo do pais.
Ela pretende comprar: cimento, barrotes e chapas de zinco para cobrir sua casa que já iniciou a construção a 1 ano atrás.
Seu maior sonho é terminar a construção da mesma e abrir um negocio grande de venda de produtos. Mas, os seus rendimentos são actualmente muito fracos e mesmo assim tem procurado fazer de tudo com o pouco para organizar o seu futuro e o do seu único filho
texts.en:
Safira is 35 years old and single. She has a school-aged son who attends school. She still lives with her parents and works as a cook at a stall. She also sells bread to increase her earnings, which are equivalent to the minimum wage in the country.
She intends to purchase cement, beams and zinc plates in order to install a roof over her house which she started building a year ago.
Her biggest dream is to finish building the house and open a large business selling merchandise. However, her income is currently very low. Nonetheless, she has strived to make the most out of what little she has, so that she can plan her and her only son's future.

loans.use: to purchase cement, beams and zinc plates.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirna de 49 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia, desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, Mirna desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión,es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Mirna is 49 years old and lives with her family in her own house.  She is a woman who fights hard and is responsible for making sure that her family doesn't lack what they need to survive.  Currently she makes a living selling food near her home and she has been doing this for several years.  She has many regular customers since her meals are offered at good prices.  

She wants to expand her stand, specifically by buying tables, chairs, and more ingredients in order to offer a menu with more variety so that she can get off to a good start economically.  However, she doesn't have enough income for this investment so she is asking for a loan to buy what she needs and therefore be able to make better profits.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, chickens, meat, vegetables, and fruits, among other things.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline, 28, is a smallholder farmer based in Eldoret which is a growing rural agricultural town in Kenya. It is home to a tribe that produces all the world famous long-distance runners. 

Last year, she started farming on her 1 acre piece of land where she grows vegetables and keeps dairy animals and poultry. So far, she has employed two people to help her run the small farm. 

Mercyline is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. An additional cow will produce additional milk for sale. The increase in income will come in handy since she is just had her second child late last year. She spends most of her time tending to her new child,

Returns from this investment will go towards loan repayment and food and medical expenses for the newborn. The money will also help her take care of household related expenses. 

She is banking on Kiva lenders to lend her a loan that would change her life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Haydee Marina

texts.es: Haydee de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija de 23n años de edad quien trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa en zona muy transitada, Haydee esta solicitando un credito para la compra de shampoo,crema, lociones, acondicionadores, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas que le dejan buenas ganancias
texts.en: Haydee is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her 23-year-old daughter who works and helps out with the household expenses.  She makes a living selling all kinds of personal products.  Her business is located close to her home in a well-trafficked area.  She is asking for a loan to buy products such as shampoo, creams, lotion, and conditioner wholesale to continue with her sales so that she can bring in good profits.

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, creams, lotion, and conditioner wholesale

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth does farming and has been in the business for 4 years now. She grows vegetables, beans and maize for sale. She is 54 years old, married and she has seven children. Her spouse also provides additional income for the support of the family.

This is her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she will use it to buy to farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family.

Beth has repaid all her previous loans successfully and her future hopes are to grow her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, born in 1974, started mixed farming 5 years ago in Kapsaret village. On her farm, she raises dairy cattle and poultry. She also grows various types of crops. However, over the years, the mother of 1 developed a biased and passionate interest in dairy farming. 

Sally is seeking a loan to expand her dairy farm. With your loan, she is planning to purchase a dairy cow that will produce additional milk for sale. Lack of capital is the major challenge standing between her present state and her future aspirations.

Part of the income generated from this investment will go to loan repayment. Profits will be ploughed back into the business to settle mounting costs and expenses. When she was asked how the loan will benefit her family, Sally replied, "It will increase family assets hence financial security."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Casty

texts.en:
Hello Lenders. Meet Casty, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Chuka area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. 

Casty, 39, has been farming for the past 15 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been bananas, milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. 

Casty is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. 

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Chuka area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Casty could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Casty, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Casty believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. 

Increased profits will allow Casty to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
Gjyste, Preng and their 5-year-old, the youngest of their five children, appear in the photo. Gjyste is seeking your financial help to buy a concrete maker that will be very helpful to her husband who has his own construction business. “Should my husband have such a machine, he will get more work, of course, and also will finish the work faster, “said Gjyste during the interview. 

Gjyste does agriculture and livestock to earn a living. She’s got one dairy cow, one sow and twenty chickens. She also farms 4 dynym (4,000 sq. meters) of agricultural land where she plants large quantities of seasonal veggies and beans, potatoes, onions, corn and wheat, which she sells. Gjyste also works for pay at a nearby fish plant.

loans.use: to invest in a concrete mixer for her husband's business

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian de  24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es casada y madre de 1  hijo de 3 años de edad .

El esposo trabaja en la agricultura como jornalero y  ellos  viven con los padres de su esposo.

Ella trabaja en una tienda en la capital desde hace un año, viene a casa cada 15 días, por ese motivo  su suegra se a quedado al cuidado de su hijo, ella decidió dedicarse a este trabajo para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar madera, lamina, clavos para reparar el techo de la vivienda, debido a que con las fuertes lluvias se esta mojando la casa.  

En el futuro su sueño es tener una vivienda propia en una comunidad libre de violencia para que su hijo tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirian is 24 years old. She has a high school education, and she is married with one son who is three years old. Her husband works in agriculture as a day laborer, and they live with her husband's parents.

For one year, she has worked in a shop in the capital. She comes home every two weeks, so her son's care falls to her mother-in-law. She decided to do this work so that she can help her husband with the household costs.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy wood, metal sheeting, and nails to repair the roof of her house, because the heavy rains are making the house wet. Her dream for the future is to own a house in a community that is free of violence so that her son can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, metal sheeting, and nails to repair the house, because the heavy rains are making the house wet.

loans.name: Assia

texts.pt:
Sra. Assia é residente da Ponta De Ouro numa casa arrendada, solteira e mãe de um filho ainda menor de idade, não tem mais nenhum dependente além de seu filho.
Conhece a Hluvuku-Adsema a sensivelmente três anos concretamente na Ponta de Ouro com base em conversas com colegas que são nossos clientes, decide pedir o financiamento para compra de uma cama. Tem como seu maior desafio construir sua própria casa e sonho ter uma viatura pessoal
texts.en:
Assia lives in Ponta de Ouro, in a rented house. She's single and has an underage son. Aside from her son, she doesn't have anyone who depends on her.
She has known Hluvuku-Adsema for about three years, specifically in Ponta de Ouro. From conversations she had with co-workers who are clients, she decided to apply for a loan in order to purchase a bed. Her biggest challenge is building a house of her own, and her dream is to own a car for personal use.

loans.use: to purchase a bed.

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, es estudiante y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el tercer año de bachillerato, no continuo sus estudios porque decidió mejor acompañarse y trabajar para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, es padre de 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad.

José trabaja como empleado en un ingenio desde hace 12 años, trabajo que lo aprendió por la misma necesidad y para poder ayudar en los gastos, para llegar a su trabajo José viaja en motocicleta 7 kilómetros trabajando 24 horas en días de por medio.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución de CREDICAMPO, es para comprar  una vaca lechera para tener leche y queso para su familia.

El sueño de José es construir una vivienda digna, para que sus hijos tengan una bonita vivienda donde puedan vivir con un poco mas de seguridad.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old.  He was a student until the 3rd year of high school, and after that he didn't continue his studies because he decided it would be better to get married and work to help his family with the household expenses.  He is the father of 2 children who are 9 and 2 years old.  

He has been an employee at a sugar factory for 12 years.  He learned this work to fulfill his needs and to be able to help with the household expenses.  José rides a motorcycle for 7 kilometers to get to work and he works 24 hours every other day.  

He is asking for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy a milk cow to produce milk and cheese for his family.  

José's dream is to build a respectable house so that his children have a beautiful home where they can live with a little more security.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to produce milk and cheese for his family.

loans.name: Al- Hosam Group

texts.en:
The Al- Hosam group consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Fatima, 37 years old, is the leader of the group. She is a married and educated woman, and a mother of seven children. Her husband is a solider who earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the household's necessary needs because of the large family. 

The family lives in a very old house and there is a threat of it falling down at any time, so it needs a quick renovation. Fatima's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to make the necessary repairs to the house.  Fatima decided to help him with that responsibility but, unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to renovate the house. Fatima's hope is to renovate all sides of the house to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate the house

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 44 years old and married with children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a smokes fish business in Ghana, and she is now requesting a 1600 GHS loan through ID Ghana to buy two cartons of smoked fish to sell. Augustina has borrowed and repaid six loans from ID Ghana before this loan. She has been running the smoked fish business for 24 years and has been earning good profits.

Augustina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish smoke and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the existing stable you see in the picure with a new one, before winter starts.

loans.name: Boris Gerson

texts.es: Boris de 35 años de edad se dedica a la reparación de escapes y radiadores desde hace 4 años, el taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de herramientas así como muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Boris, 35, has been repairing exhaust systems and radiators for 4 years. His workshop is located in his home. He lives in his own house with his wife and 3 children. He is requesting this loan to purchase tools as shown in the image so he can continue with his work and thus be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Esta cliente é casada maritalmente e é mae de 6 filhos dos quais 3 são do sexo masculino e os outros 3 do sexo femenino com as idades compreendidas entre os 4 e 15 anos de idade. Faz conta própria que se dedica na venda de produtos de primeira necessidade mas tem seu marido que trabalha como segurança numa instancia turística, que a ajuda nas dispesas domesticas.
 É cliente da Hluvuku a 4 anos e já levantou 5 emprestimos  e com o valor do ultimo financiamento a cliente pretende comprar chapas de zinco, barrotes, sacos de cimento e pagar o transporte do mesmo material.
 Seu maior sonho é ver sua casa concluída e bem mobilada.
O seu maior desafio é construir sua casa sendo que ainda vive numa casa de construção precária
texts.en:
Joana is married and has six children, three of whom are boys and three are girls. They range in age from 4 to 15 years. She runs her own business selling products that are household staples. However, her husband works as a security guard for a tourist site and helps her pay for household expenses.
She has been a client of Hluvuku for four years and has already gotten five loans. With the current loan she intends to purchase zinc plates, beams, and sacks of cement, and to pay for transportation of these materials.
Her biggest dream is to see her house finished and well furnished.
Her biggest challenge is building her house, because she still lives in a house that's in precarious conditions.

loans.use: to purchase zinc plates, beams, and sacks of cement, and to pay for transportation of these materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Benkan est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam IIde la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33anset ont au moins 3enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que,Beurres de karité,Produits Cosmétiques, Condiments, Savons, et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois.
Abi est un membre du groupe Benkan,assise 2ème de gauche et à droite,Vendeuse des produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des produits cosmétiques (Pommades, crèmes, lotions et fond de teint)en quantité et en qualités  au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkan comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Abi compte réaliser  155 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkan is a group of women from the Darsalam II district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 33 years of age and have at least three children. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as shea butter, cosmetic products, condiments, soaps, and more. 

To expand their businesses, the group members had decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program for the first time. 

Abi, a member of the group Benkan, is sitting second from the left in the photo. A vendor of cosmetics, she intends to use her loan to purchase cosmetic products (ointments, creams, lotions, and foundation) of different quantities and qualities over time. She makes her sales retail to a diverse customer base. She procures her supplies at the market. 

While the other members of the group Benkan plan on making an average profit of 150,000 francs CFA each over the course of this cycle, Ms. Koniba plans on making 155,000 francs. 

In addition to paying back the loans, the group members use part of the revenues to cope with personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They would like to see bolstered this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, so that their inventory levels do not drop too low.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fatima de 30 años de edad posee desde hace 7 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela que la buscan por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de granos básicos, sopas, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para surtir mas la tienda y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Fatima is 30 years old. For the past 7 years, she has had a small store located in the place where she lives. She has lots of customers who look for her because of her good prices and the variety of her products. She lives in her own house with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, soups, snacks, soft drinks, etc. in order to stock her store more and to produce a better income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, snacks, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  DEMBAGNOUMA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à SANOUBOUGOU I  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame AWA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  DEMBAGNOUMA , fait la vente des  pagnes wax réal . Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  20 pièces de pagnes wax réal au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 56 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son Intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group DEMBAGNOUMA are married women, who average 37 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in SANOUBOUGOU I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their 12th solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. AWA, who is sitting first from the right in the photo of this women’s group DEMBAGNOUMA, sells Réal Wax ’pagnes’ (a brand of the colorful cloth of western Africa). She intends to use her loan to purchase 30 lengths of Réal Wax pagne cloth at the big market, where she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products, which she sells retail to women customers paying with cash or credit at the market.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 56,000 francs CFA. Part of it is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase Réal Wax ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi a pour mari un juriste. Elle a 04 enfants en charge dont 02 scolarisés. Elle est couturière de profession et en même temps revendeuse de chemises depuis 1996. Akouvi fait son second prêt pour acheter des tissus pour coudre des chemises. Elle espère augmenter la taille de son activité et suivre l'éducation de ses enfants grâce aux profits.
texts.en: Akouvi has a husband who is a legal expert. She supports four children, of whom two are in school. She is a clothier by trade and at the same time has been selling shirts since 1996. Akouvi is taking out her second loan to purchase some cloth to sew into shirts. She hopes to expand her business and continue providing an education for her children with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase shirts

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a jovial smallholder farmer based in Kurgung village found in the North Rift region of Kenya. At 29, she is happy with 5 children who look up to her. To provide a decent living for them, she keeps dairy cattle and poultry that produce milk and eggs for both consumption and sale. She also grows maize and vegetables.

Leah has always had a proclivity for dairy farming. She has enjoyed doing it for a decade. She is seeking a loan to expand her dairy farm. With your money, she is going to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will give her a additional milk for sale to boost her income. She is going to name the cow 'Miso'.

She will use the money generated from the milk sales to repay the loan in full. Profits from the investment will enable her to meet high input costs. When asked how the loan will be of benefit to her family, Leah replied, "It will increase my family's income and financial stability."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nora Esmeralda

texts.es:
Nora de 32 años de edad, es empleada y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 3° grado, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 5 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a las actividades de la albañilería, mientras que Nora se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también trabaja como empleada en una alcaldía, para llegar a su trabajo Nora viaja en bus 15 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El crédito que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar material eléctrico para la instalación de la energía en su casa ya que no tiene.

Nora sueña con ampliar su vivienda, que sus hijos se preparen académicamente para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo y tener un terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Nora is 32 years old and is employed. She studied until the 3rd grade. She is married and is the mother of 3 children, ages 16, 13, and 5. Her husband works as a brick layer while Nora does the housework. She also works as an employee in the city hall. To arrive at her job, Nora travels 15 kilometers by bus. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

The loan she is requesting from Credicampo is to buy electrical equipment to install electricity in her house since she doesn't have any.

Nora's dreams are to expand her home, that her children are academically prepared so that they have better job opportunities in the future, and to have farm land.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment to install electricity in her house since she doesn't have any.

loans.name: No Jesus No Life Group

texts.en:
The "No Jesus No Life" group is on its fifth loan cycle and is requesting a total loan amount of GHS 4,400 to expand various businesses. They are very hard working women and believe this loan will help them take care of their families. They are into ripe plantain chips, groceries, jewelry, nails, paints and polished woods.

One member of the group is Faustina who makes a living selling nails, paints and polished woods. Faustina wants to get ahead and is sacrificing certain things in order to have a better quality of life for her family and her loved ones.

Faustina is applying for this loan in order to buy nails, paints and polished woods and continue with her sales. She can then fight for a higher income to give to her family and loved ones.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy nail, paints and polished woods for resale.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a father of two children, 18 and 15 years old. He is a 45-year-old villager and wants to buy a dairy cow. To achieve this goal, he is asking for your financial help.

Andrea does agriculture/livestock to make a living. He’s got a cow at the moment and also plants beans and peas, which he sells in large quantities in their dried form. In addition to this rural activity, he works for pay as a night man.

A bit about his village: it’s a hilly village where villagers plant mostly corn, wheat, potatoes and onions and sell them dried. They also have cows, sheep and goats. Tending orchards such as apples, cherries and grapevines are daily activities, and on some of their wetlands, they plant medicinal plants.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nebema

texts.fr:
Mme NEBEMA se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants, le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 10 ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Madame est commerçante depuis 20 ans. Elle  s’approvisionne dans les pays voisins. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier et les passants.
Elle  veut s’acheter 03 balles de pagnes, 100 sacs, 20 sachets de bijoux et une dizaine de glacières.
Mme NEBEMA veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour épargner. Elle compte  ouvrir un grand magasin et souhaite contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. NEBEMA is in very good health. A married woman, she is the mother of two children. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 10. Both are in school. She has two persons to support. Ms. NEBEMA has been a merchant for twenty years. She gets her supplies from neighboring countries. Her customers are the residents of her district and visitors. 

She wants to purchase 3 bales of ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), 100 bags, 20 pouches of gems or jewelry, and a dozen insulated containers. She wants to put her profits into her savings. She is planning on opening a large store and would like to help her family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase ‘pagne’ cloth, bags, jewelry, and some insulated containers

loans.name: Twitezimbere Cb Group

texts.en: Eugenie is a group leader, aged 25 years old. She is married with 4-yearl-old twins. The group is called TWITEZIMBERE which means “support themselves” in English. They sell different items and they have common goals for changing their life through loans. With the loan, she would like to buy more banana and sorghum for making local beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more banana and sorghum for making local beer for sale.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Ana es una señora de 44 años de edad, es ama de casa, por falta de recursos económicos no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, esta soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 28, 26 y 20 años de edad.

Ana se dedica al comercio, venta de pescado desde hace 5 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su madre y por la misma necesidad que ellos estaban pasando, para llegar a su trabajo Ana viaja en bus 20 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 8:00 am a 3:00 pm. Todos los días.

El préstamo que Ana esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar pescado y surtir mas su negocio, así podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos para darle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Ana es tener su propia vivienda, tener 20 animales y tener un terrenito agrícola.
texts.en:
Ana, 44, is a stay-at-home mom. Due to a lack of financial resources, she did not have the opportunity to study. She is single and has three children, ages 20, 26 and 28.

Ana has been selling fish for 5 years. She learned about this work from her mother due to their family's needs. To get to work, Ana travels 20 kilometers by bus. She works from 8:00am to 3:00pm every day.

Ana is applying for a loan from CrediCampo to buy fish and stock her business. She will then earn a higher income to give her parents a better quality of life.

Ana's dream is to have her own home, to have 20 animals and to own farmland.

loans.use: to buy fish and stock her business to earn a higher income and give her parents a better quality of life.

loans.name: Sharla

texts.en: Sharla is a single woman, 39 years old, and lives with her mother. Sharla has a rental shop where she sells paint were and constructions materials. Previously, she worked for others in their stores. Sharla wants to amplify her stock by buying more paint materials and nuts and bolts. For this, she needs a loan of SRD 8000.  Sharla wants to make a lot of profit so she can set up her own shop in the future instead of a rental shop.

loans.use: To buy paint materials, and nuts and bolts for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and rafters and to pay workers.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.
