loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Estrellas De Pacaman Group

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que mujeres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de mujeres campesinas dedicadas al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. Es el trabajo que realiza Veronica de 24 años soltera con una gran aspiración hacia el futuro, ella es una joven emprendedora que está decidida a superar en la vida. (Veronica es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)

La actividad que realiza Veronica todos los días bajo un sol agotador es el cultivo de tomate, ella ha venido realizando dicha actividad durante 4 años, es la actividad que le ha generado ingresos económicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. La cosecha que espera sacar este año  son cosechas de tomates  para luego venderlo en el mercado de su comunidad.

Ella es un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres de unieron a Veronica para emprender juntas el cultivo de tomates para que ellas también mejoren las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

El uso del préstamo es par la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos y químicos, para poder obtener una muy buena cosecha, para tener un mejor ingreso económico para mejorar aún más las condiciones de vida de su familia y  comunidad. Uno de las más grandes aspiraciones de ella es ver que sus hermanos se conviertan en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales y comprar más terrenos para poder cultivar más tomatas par realizar una mejor venta con las que ahora realiza.
texts.en:
The earth has been blessed by hands that like to work and take care of it. The work women have done for years and for their entire lives is a worthy occupation. Without the labor of female farmers dedicated to cultivating it, the earth would not produce the fruits which sustain every generation. This is Veronica's work, which she does with great dreams for the future. She is a 24-year-old entrepreneur who is determined to succeed in life. In the photo, she is the first on the left. 

Veronica's business activity, which she does every day beneath an exhausting sun, is growing tomatoes. She has had this activity for 4 years, and it has brought in a financial income to improve her family's living conditions. She hopes to obtain a tomato harvest this year to sell at the local market.

She is a role model in her community, which is why a group of women joined her to grow tomatoes together and to improve their families' living conditions as well. 

Veronica will use this loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to obtain a very good harvest. She will then have a higher financial income to further improve her family's life and that of her community. One of her greatest dreams is to see her siblings become professionals in various fields of work. She would also like to buy more land to grow more tomatoes and make more sales.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Ten hard working ladies compose the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Nueva Esperanza”, meaning “New Hope,” that is located in San Cristóbal, Totonicapán, in the western highlands of Guatemala. Two of the women are new to the group and are quite excited about opportunities for growth, not only for themselves but for their families as well. 

Santa is 38 years old with three children and is quite pleased that two of them are in elementary school. She  is a member of the Trust Bank. Santa works along with her husband in a family business. The couple creates and decorates beautiful traditional skirts called “cortes.”  The “cortes,” that vary from three to six yards of fabric, are usually woven on a treadle loom by men.  Each village has its own unique design and hemline length. The women step into the tubular shape of the “corte,” tuck their ornately decorated blouse or “huipil” into it, and complete the outfit with a handmade embroidered belt called a “faja.”

Santa is quite creative and sees the necessity of updating her designs and improving the quality of the fabric that she weaves. She is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase thread, dye, parts for the loom, and supplies for her textile business. Her goal is to increase sales, generate additional income, and improve the living standard of her family. Her family is committed to helping her meet the demand of her clients. Her children and husband are quite involved in the business. Santa also employs  a young man who helps her deliver the finished “cortes.”
 
The ladies of the “Nueva Esperanza” Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings with a Loan Officer from Friendship Bridge. They not only make payments on their loans but also participate in educational seminars that cover a wide variety of timely subjects. Some of these topics include effective business management practices, health, hygiene, and the use of medicinal plants as well as self-esteem and women’s rights. Recently, the women learned about childhood and teenage pregnancy. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus.” It is a most effective combination.

KIVA investors bring hope to the women of the Trust Bank and are much appreciated. The ladies can step into a brighter future as empowered women eliminating poverty. We look forward to providing an update to you on the members of the “Nueva Esperanza” Trust Bank.

loans.use: to purchase thread, dye, parts for the loom, and supplies for her textile business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al negocio propio, venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 2 años sus ventas las realiza desde su casa de habitación vende pollo, manteca, harina, maseca, margarina, refrescos,  etc. y sus clientes principales son personas que viven en su misma comunidad.
Doña Antonia  tiene su negocio en un punto estratégico porque a su alrededor no hay muchas pulperías cercanas, solicita el préstamo para la compra de producto como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, agua, queso, harina, huevos, etc. y  surtir  su negocio, espera que las ganancias que obtenga le ayuden a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Antonia su sueño es poder lograr que sus hijos se gradúen en el colegio y que puedan ser personas que triunfen en la vida.

Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Antonia is a female entrepreneur who is dedicated to her business, a grocery store which she has had for 2 years. She sells chicken, butter, flour, margarine, soft drinks, etc. from her home. Her clients are mainly people who live in her community.

Antonia's business is located in a strategic location because there are not many grocery stores nearby. She is applying for a loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, water, cheese, flour, eggs, etc. to stock her business. She hopes that the income she earns will help her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Antonia's dream is for her children to graduate from school and become people who triumph in life.

Danlí, Honduras – September 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, water, cheese, flour, eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael de 45 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la reparacion  de relojes, cadenas y pulseras, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, vive en casa propia con su hijo de 24 años de edad quien trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos de la casa, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de herramientas, pinzas, baterías, brazaletes, etc. para segir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 45, has worked for 30 years repairing watches, chains, and bracelets.  His business is located in his place of residence.  He has a large clientele thanks to the quality with which he does his work.  

He lives in his own home with his child, who is 24 years old.  His child works and helps him with the household expenses.  

He is asking for a loan for the purchase of tools, pliers, batteries, bracelets, etc., in order to continue with his work, because it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy tools, pliers, batteries, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
In 2011, Cesaria learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. 

She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. She borrowed another amount to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. This will help her farming income a big boost. 

Cesaria looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Sorateñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SORATEÑAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos cosméticos, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace quince años, ya que este negocio era muy rentable y conocía la dinámica de trabajo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The "Sorateñas" communal bank is starting its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional hub. This group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Nancy is the president. The members' business are varied and include selling cosmetics, selling clothing, selling food, selling fruit, selling tomatoes, and a sewing workshop.

This loan will benefit small business owners like Nancy. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago by invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a client of the institution. She has a business selling fruit. She says that she started this business fifteen years ago because it is very profitable and she was familiar with the dynamics of this work.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying wholesale fruit from vendors in the city of El Alto. She will later sell the fruit in her sales location. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she is married with four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training offered by the institution's staff.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit.

loans.name: Mujeres De Pasaccap Group

texts.en:
The rural area of San Cristóbal is located in the western highlands of Guatemala, about 189 km. from Guatemala City. The majority of the population works in traditional textile production and animal husbandry. Others work fabricating modern clothing such as tee shirts and pants. The ten women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres de Pasaccap” work in these businesses in order to generate income for their families  and raise their standard of living.

Raimunda is 29 years old and is a member of the Trust Bank. She is separated from her husband and is raising her son as a single mother. She is committed to having a comfortable home for her son and to achieve that goal, she needed to generate income.  Raimunda has a small textile business and sews pants. She is able to make just enough income to cover the household expenses and those of her son. But Raimunda needs more capital to inject into the business and increase sales. She now sells her pants by the dozen each week. Raimunda wants to purchase an additional sewing machine and perhaps hire an employee. Her dream is to teach her son how to sew so that the two of them can become business partners and, working together,  generate more income for the family.

Most of the women in the Friendship Bridge Trust Banks have had little or no formal education. Therefore, the ladies are eager to learn about relevant and timely subjects so that they can more effectively manage their loans and elevate the living standard in their families. Each month, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer coordinates participatory educational seminars for the women. Topics can range from self esteem, health and hygiene to violence against women, childhood pregnancy. They learn how to manage their loans with information about accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing and other effective business practices. “Microcredit Plus” is the name that Friendship Bridge calls the partnership of loans and education.

The women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres de Pasaccap” share that they are most appreciative of the kindness and generosity of KIVA investors. Armed with their new tools, they are poised to step into a brighter and more successful future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es una mujer de 62 años, soltera, tiene un hijo independiente y su negocio es la venta de empanadas.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, constante, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en el ‘Plan 3000’ que es un inmenso y pobre barrio de casi 300mil habitantes, en su mayoría aymaras, quechuas y guaraníes; un micro-mundo integrado por las 36 etnias bolivianas. 
Micaela es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello castaño largo, su lengua natal es el guaraní que ya no utiliza porque en el comercio utiliza el español. Su negocio mayormente lo realiza antes de las 12 del medio día en la rotonda del lugar, sobre un suelo de tierra espolvoreada por el viento y media docena de palmeras enanas que adornan el ambiente además del sol radiante que castiga a los peatones. Ella trabaja sola y cada día debe empujar su carro hasta encontrar alguna sombra donde poder acomodarse. Ella sueña con tener un puesto fijo de venta para no tener que cargar con su carro todos los días. También desea realizar la compra por mayor de ingredientes para empanadas, como; harina, pasas de uva, aceitunas, papa, cebollas, etc. y también su casa necesita refacciones; como arreglo del techo, cambiar tuberías viejas, etc.
Es por esos motivos que Micaela solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor y refacción de vivienda.
texts.en:
Micaela, 62, is single and has one independent son. She has a business selling empanadas.

She is enterprising, tenacious, strong, consistent, patient, responsible, and hardworking. She works in "Plan 3000", which is a large, poor neighborhood of nearly 300,000 inhabitants who are mainly Aymaras, Quechuans and Guaranis. It is a microworld made up of the 36 Bolivian ethnicities.

Micaela is dark-skinned and of medium height, with long brown hair. Her native language is Guaraní, which she does not use anymore because Spanish is used in commerce. She works in her business before noon in a local roundabout, on a dirt floor made dusty by the wind and surrounded by a half dozen short palm trees which decorate the area, along with the radiant sun which punishes pedestrians. She works alone, and every day she has to push her cart until she finds shade where she can make herself comfortable. 

She dreams of having a fixed location so she does not have to load up her cart every day. She also wants to buy wholesale ingredients to make empanadas, such as flour, raisins, olives, potatoes, onions, etc. Her home also needs repairs, such as fixing the roof, changing out old pipes, etc. Therefore, Micaela has applied for a loan to buy wholesale cooking supplies and to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cooking supplies and renovate her home.

loans.name: Francis Yanett

texts.es:
La  señora  Zoila   de  48  años  de edad  es casada y vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación y cuenta con un puesto en el mercado local del municipio,  vende  ropa interior para dama y caballeros, ropa de niño, juguetes, desodorantes y cremas, etc.
Doña Zoila  es una persona muy luchadora  y está muy contenta con el apoyo que se le está brindando, vive en el municipio de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Zoila  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blúmeres, braseares, vestidos, blusas, camisas, pantalones, también para compra de  juguetes para el día del niño, espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda y mejore sus ingresos. 
Su sueño es  surtir más su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Septiembre del 2014
texts.en:
Zoila, age 48, is married and lives with her husband in their home.  She lives in the town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  She has a stall in the local town market.  She sells underwear for women and men, children’s clothing, toys, deodorants, lotions, etc.

Zoila is a very hardworking person.  She is very happy with the support that has been given to her. 

Zoila is asking for a loan to buy underwear, bras, dresses, tops, shirts, and pants, as well as toys for Children’s Day.  She hopes that this investment will be a big help to her and improve her income.

Her dream is to stock her business better and get better earnings.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy underwear, bras, dresses, tops, shirts, pants, etc., for his business

loans.name: Justina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Justina tiene la edad de 48 años es casada y madre de dos niños uno de ellos ya independiente. Es originaria de Chinandega pero vive en Managua, hace 20 años comenzó el negocio, es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de comida su mama vendía fritanga en Chinandega y de ella aprendió el oficio y ahora se dedica a comercializarlo en la ciudad de Managua.

Su familia es su principal apoyo y juntos han logrado salir adelante, dentro de sus principales metas está aumentar su negocio y mejorar su infraestructura. Requiere el préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas y así ofrecerles a los clientes mayor comodidad. El crédito le ayudara a aumentar la capacidad del negocio con más sillas y mesas.
texts.en: Justina is 48 years old. She is married and has two children, one of them who is already independent. She is a native of Chinandega, but she lives in Managua. She started her business 20 years ago. She is a businesswoman: she works selling food. Her mother used to sell fried food in Chinandega, and from her she learned the business. Now she works selling it in the city of Managua. Her family is her main support, and together they have been able to move ahead. Among her main goals are to expand her business and to improve her infrastructure. She needs this loan to buy chairs and tables so she can offer her customers more comfort. The loan will help her increase the business' capacity with more chairs and tables.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Felicito Cristino

texts.es: felicito de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, desde hace varios años el se dedica a la siembra de plátanos, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientela establecida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos y mejorar el terreno donde esta la plantación para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Felicito is 41 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and his three children. For many years he has worked growing bananas. When his harvest is ready, he sells it at different markets and he already has established customers. He is requesting a loan to buy manure and improve the soil where his plantation is located so he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy manure and improve the soil.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia  sigue dedicándose a la ganadería y a la  venta de quesos y yogurt, la socia vende a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca.
La socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Soledad is still raising livestock and selling cheese and yogurt. She sells to her clients who make orders. She is a responsible, persevering person, which is how she provides for her family.

She is applying for a loan to buy a cow. She is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building the façade of her home

loans.name: Above All Group

texts.en:
This group, called Above All, consists of eight ladies who live in the area of Ghana. The group has applied for a loan of GHS 12,700 from ID-Ghana (Kiva's Partner). All the members of this group are involved in different activities like towels, slippers, wigs, kenkey (cooked corn dough) and fish, bed sheets,  ladies' tops, and fresh fish. 

Comfort, a 49-year-old married mother with one dependent child, has been working as a vendor selling Kenkey (cooked corn dough) and fried fish. She started her business with a small amount of capital and would now like to increase her sales volume in order to increase her profit and raise her child well. 

She, along with her group, is requesting this loan and she will use her portion to purchase more corn dough, fish, and firewood to prepare kenkey and sell to the customers. This is a tradition food which is like by many customers thereby put her on the advantage as a trader. 

Comfort hopes to expand her business to live comfortably with her family. She, along with her group members, is very excited and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support. The group members will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more corn dough, fish, and firewood to prepare kenkey and sell to the customers.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. 

In addition, Tecla is selling groceries in a tuck shop where she rents a table. She sells products such as salt, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. She has been running this business for six months now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Tecla will purchase salt, sugar, soap, and cooking oil to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grafted cacao seedlings

loans.name: Chavelas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAVELAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Albertina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de videos, venta de comida, artesana en yeso, venta de frescos, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Albertina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace diez años, con un poco capital que posteriormente fue ampliando. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material escolar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella esta soltera y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The “Chavelas" communal bank will begin their fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is lead by a board of directors where Albertina is the president.  The communal bank members carry out various businesses, among them: a video store, food sales, plaster crafts, drink sales, and a bookstore.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small-time entrepreneurs, one of whom is Albertina.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, signing up at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the organization.  Currently she has a bookstore.  She shares that she began this business ten years ago, with a little bit of capital that later she increased.

The loan that she is currently taking out is to increase her capital (buy school supplies in bulk).  She will buy them from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell them in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family financially, because she is single and has a daughter.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training that personnel from the institution offer.

loans.use: to buy school supplies in bulk

loans.name: Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roscio es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas para niños, venta de papa y chuño, venta de ropa interior, tienda de barrio, distribuidor de carne de pollo, venta de sandalias, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Roscio es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una campaña de promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por al observar que este negocio era necesario en su zona y que podría haber un amplio comercio de productos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de arroz, azúcar y fideo por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Rosas" communal bank is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional hub. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Roscio is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include knitting children's sweaters, selling potatoes and freeze-dried potato flour, selling underwear, a neighborhood store, distributing chicken, selling sandals, and a transportation service.

This loan will benefit small business owners like Roscio. She says that this is the first time she is joining Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation from a promotional campaign of the institution. Her business is a neighborhood store. She says that she started this business when she noticed that this business was needed in her area and that she could sell a wide variety of products.

She will use this loan to increase her merchandise by buying wholesale rice, sugar, and noodles from wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto. She will then sell the products in her store. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she is in a common-law marriage and has one son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en: Phallin is 22 years old and a student at a university. Her major is banking and finance. She lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Because of a lack of financial support, Phallin would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees for two years. This loan will help her graduate and be able to find a job to help her family. In the future, she is going to find a good job.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has mastered her hog raising business in Larena. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. 

When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail of credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her hog raising business, so will she be with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of PHP 14,900 will help her build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Norma, la socia sigue  dedicándose  a la  producción y venta de lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt,  la socia vende a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
This associate is Norma.  She continues to work producing and selling dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt.  She sells to customers who ask for her products.  She is a responsible and diligent person, since this is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is asking for this loan for the purchase of milk, among other items.

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop in her business, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, among other items.

loans.name: Xiomy Estefany

texts.es: Xiomy, es una joven de 19 años de edad,  estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la universidad del Callao al cual le dedica 6 horas diarias, le va muy bien en los estudios, se considera una persona muy inteligente y nos cuenta que no ha tenido ningún obstáculo académico y al terminar sus estudios tiene sueños como al culminar sus estudios poder  trabajar en un Banco y en futuro lograr tener su empresa para  ayudar a sus padres y sacarlos adelante, se siente orgullosa de haber conseguido el  préstamo que solicito porque la ayudara  para poder estudiar  ingles, idioma que Ella llama su pasión. Se encuentra muy agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA porque gracias a su confianza podrá poner en marcha los objetivos que se ha trazado en su vida personal y estudiantil.
texts.en:
Xiomy, 19, is a Business Administration student at the University of Callao. She studies for six hours per day, and her studies are going very well. She considers herself to be a very intelligent person and she says that she has not had any academic obstacles. Upon finishing her studies, she dreams of working in a bank and later having her own business to help her parents and provide for them. 

She feels proud of having obtained a loan because it will help her to study English, a language which she calls her passion. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, she will be able to put her personal and academic goals in action.

loans.use: to pay for her English studies.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia es la señora María Cleofe, la socia continua con su negocio de ganadería, la socia lleva es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
L Asocia solicito el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
María Cleofe is still working in her livestock business. She is a responsible, persevering person who wishes to continue working to support her family.

She has applied for a loan to buy feed for her animals. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business activity. She promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en: Abundia, 58 years old, is married and has four children. She settled for a living in Misamis Occidental with her family. She helps her husband in their fishing business. She sells freshly caught fish in the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase more fish to sell. She plans to acquire a new fishing boat to be used for the business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Everando

texts.en: Everando, 36, is married and the father of four. He resides in Misamis Occidental with his family. He provides his family with his income from farming. He has been used to working on the farm since he was with his parents. He became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2013 and has borrowed a loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer and new seedlings for his garden. He plans to cultivate all the vacant lots of his farm to ensure a greener farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer and new seedlings for his garden.

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en: Chuchi is a widow and lives with her three children in Misamis Occidental. She has been selling snacks in their village for three years to make a living. She had to move forward for the benefit of her children. She became a member of Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell. In the future, she plans to build a store to make a business to have a better income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell.

loans.name: Jiadema

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jiadema works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening. Jiadema is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell for her general store business.

Jiadema has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lea Nenet

texts.en:
Lea Nenet is 48 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lea Nenet has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 34 years old and married with three children, who are all attend in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Rose has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida is 22 years old and a student. Her major is veterinary medicine. She lives with her parents in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Because of a lack of financial support, Lida would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she is going to run a stall selling poultry and animal feed and veterinary drugs.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en al sur de la ciudad, que es conocida por la diversidad de comida típica y su fiesta patronal de cada año en honor a la "Patrona del Oriente Boliviano", milagrosa imagen de la Virgen María que el pueblo venera cada año y donde los creyentes van a pie. 
Marlene es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo suelto, su lengua natal es el guaraní que ya casi olvidó porque en el comercio en esta área se utiliza el español. Su negocio es la venta de comida típica del lugar, como; el Locro, Picante de gallina, patasca, majadito de pato, de pollo, anticucho, entre otros. Su sueño es tener su casa propia. Ella desea realizar la ampliación de su puesto de venta, comprando una heladera, mesas y sillas para poder atender a más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Marlene solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera y muebles para la ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en: Marlene is a 36 year old woman. She is single, has no children and her business is selling food. She is independent, constant, responsible and hardworking. She works in the South of the city, which is known for the diversity in typical food and its saint feast in honor of the "Saint of Eastern Bolivia", the miraculous image of the Virgin Mary, revered by the people every year and where all believers go see by foot. Marlene is dark skinned, of medium height, long loose hair. Her native language is guarani, which she almost forgot because Spanish is used to do business in the area. Her business is selling typical local food of the place such as locro (stew), spicy chicken, patasca (soup), duck and chicken majadito, anticucho (kebab), among others. Her dream is to have her own house. She wants to expand her place of sale buying a refrigerator, tables and chairs in order to serve more customers and improve her income. This is why Marlene is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and furniture to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and furniture to expand her business.

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Aleja pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia tiene 03 hijos, tiene 51 años de edad y es casada, la socia  se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito
texts.en:
Aleja belongs to the “San Bartolome de Tambo Real” communal bank.  She has three children.  She is fifty-one years old and is married.  She works in agriculture and cattle and has been doing this for years.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her business, and she is committed to making her payments.  She wants to be able to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family.  She is asking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Desedeia

texts.en:
Desedeia helps her husband working on their own farm for a living. She resides in Misamis Occidental. She sells freshly harvested vegetables from their farm to make a living. She earns very well from this and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm fertilization costs. To make a greener farm, she recently took a new loan to buy manure fertilizer and a new variety of seedlings.

In the future, Desedeia wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family and hopes to improve and sustain the farm to ensure a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy manure fertilizer and a new variety of seedlings.

loans.name: Maria  Nessa

texts.en:
Maria Nessa is determined to withstand the ups and downs of her farming activities.

She knows if she fails, she won't be able to support the needs of her family. She joined PMPC to borrow money for her business for land and seedbed preparation. She availed herself of a loan needed for the next cropping season.

Maria Nessa perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals of continuously providing for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Maria  Rosalina

texts.en:
Mahayag is a vast agricultural land and Maria Rosalina took advantage of the location for her business. She is a farmer who grows rice. This has been going on for more than a decade now, and primarily supports her family.

In need of additional capital to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer, she applied for a loan to PMPC. She hopes to have a good harvest for the next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Arlene

texts.en: Ma. Arlene, 44 years old, is married and a resident of Tabon, Jose Dalaman, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. They have been in this business for many years already. Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. On January 28, 2012 both Arlene and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But in addition to the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy her fish for resale. She wishes that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Viacha En Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIACHA EN PROGRESO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teresa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de rellenos, tienda de barrio, servicio de enfermería, servicio de transporte, elaboración y venta de salteñas, venta de tucumanas, repostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teresa es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su vecina que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de rellanos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el apoyo de su familia quien le impulso económicamente y moralmente, ya que apreciaban su buen sazón. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en: The Group “VIACHA EN PROGRESO” will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Hub of Cascada. It is comprised by eight members and is led by a board of directors where Teresa is the President. The members work in diverse businesses such as: sale of stuffed potatoes, neighborhood shop, nursing services, transportation services, preparation and sale of salteñas (empanadas), sale of tucumanas (empanadas), pastry preparation. The loan will benefit the small businesswomen where Teresa is a member. She says that it has been a year that she is part of Pro Mujer. She joined because a neighbor who is a client of the institution invited her. Currently, she has a business selling stuffed potatoes. She says that she started this business with the support of her family who inspired her financially and morally because they liked her good flavor. She will get a credit to increase capital (to buy potatoes at wholesale price) that she will purchase from the saleswomen of the city of El Alto, and that later she will sell in her place of sale. This form of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she has a common law husband and a son. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy potatoes at wholesale price.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, madre de dos hijos, y su negocio es una tienda de ferretería.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, responsable, buena madre y muy trabajadora. su negocio lo realiza en el sur de su ciudad que se caracteriza por tener la renta per cápita más alta del país, con una elevada tasa de crecimiento anual, representada principalmente por la producción agropecuaria y forestal, es además la zona boliviana más importante de producción hidrocarburífera. 
Claudia es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo amarrado, su forma de vestir es a la moda y su lengua materna es el español, también conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar. Su negocio es una próspera tienda de ferretería con repuestos en general, ella trabaja de lunes a sábado, la acompañan sus pequeños hijos que aún no asisten a la escuela. Su sueño es tener sucursales de su negocio. Ella desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia realizando la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de accesorios para vehículos y con los beneficios poder mandar a sus hijos a una buena escuela.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para la compra de accesorios para vehículo y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 28-year-old woman, single, and the mother of two children. Her business is a hardware store. 

She is independent, enterprising, responsible, a good mother, and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the south of her city which is characterized by having the highest rent per capita in the country, with an elevated yearly rate of growth, mainly represented by farming and forestry production. It is also the most important Bolivian zone of hydrocarbon production. 

Claudia is dark-skinned, of medium stature, has long black hair tied back, her way of dress is fashionable, and her native language is Spanish. She also knows Guaraní from family legacy. 

Her business is a prosperous hardware store with general replacement parts. She works from Monday to Saturday. Her small children accompany her because they still do not attend school. Her dream is to have branches of her business. She wishes to improve the quality of life of her family, realizing the expansion of her business through the purchase of vehicle accessories and with the earnings be able to send her children to a good school.

It is for these reasons that Claudia requests a loan for the purchase of vehicle accessories and with the earnings pay the expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories and with the earnings pay the expenses of her two children.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 37 years old, lives in Siquijor, Philippines with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to make an income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands & snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in her financing needs. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 5,000 PHP to buy more raw ingredients for her food and snack vending business. 

She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a small food house.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients for her food and snack vending business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a 32-year-old mother of two who resides in Misamis Occidental with her family. She helps her husband on their banana farm to make a living. She became a member of GDMPC this year and is borrowing a loan to purchase more planting materials for banana production and manure fertilizer. She plans to expand the farm to make sure that she will generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more planting materials for banana production and manure fertilizer

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, logro atraer a nuevos clientes con el financiamiento anterior, generándole así una mejor situación económica con la que las circunstancias familiares son más dignas y ha incorporado la venta de gas propano en su negocio.
Como una forma de mantener su negocio con vida se decidió por solicitar un crédito nuevo para comprar leña, bebidas, quesos y gas propano, surtirá el inventario para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Miguel was able to attract new customers with the help of the previous loan.  This generated a better financial situation for him and provided more dignified circumstances for his family since he added propane gas to his sales.

In order to keep his business going, he decided to ask for a loan to buy firewood, beverages, cheeses, and propane gas.  He will increase his inventory so he can keep his customers happy.

loans.use: comprar leña, bebidas, quesos y gas propano, surtirá el inventario para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MILAGROS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de videos, venta de comida, artesana en yeso, venta de frescos, librería, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados por catálogo; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace seis años, ya que anteriormente ya había trabajado en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, obteniendo conocimiento del proceso de venta. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzaos por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella esta soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Milagros" (Miracles) will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional center. It is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Silvia is the president. The businesses that the members of the association run are varied. Among them are: video store, selling food, handicrafts in plaster, selling cold drinks, bookstore, and selling footwear.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Silvia is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At this time she has a business of selling footwear by catalog. She lets it be known that she launched this business six years ago, since before that she had already worked in the sale of cosmetics by catalog, obtaining knowledge of the sales process.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy footwear wholesale, which she will acquire from the distributors in the city of El Alto and later sell in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the staff from the institution offer.

loans.use: to buy footwear wholesale

loans.name: Mabella

texts.en:
Mabella, 58 years old, lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two children. Her husband works in construction and brings home a meager income for the family. Mabella has found ways to attain income through a retail business. 

She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a Member in Good Standing, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for PHP 14,900 to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad has signed up her membership with PMPC and borrowed the needed capital to start up her agricultural business. She plants a variety of crops and vegetables. She is thankful for the capital extended to a small time borrower like her. 

Soledad has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to pay labor costs as she is cultivating another farm area. 

In the future, she hopes to make a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers to take care of his crops, expecting better quality and quantity of production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated metal to refurbish her roof

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia Albertina continua dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de  profesora trabajando  en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Paucartambo,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para los estudios de sus hijos.
La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member, Albertina, continuous to pursue her teaching career, working in one of the schools in the city of Paucartambo.  The member is a responsible and earnest person.

She wishes to continue working and in this manner continue to support her family.  She is applying for a loan for studies of her children.


She appreciates and values ​​the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Roxana continua  trabajando en el área de administración en una entidad del estado, la socia pertenece al banco comunal “Camino al Progreso”, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia  requiere el préstamo para los estudios de sus hijos.
 La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The partner, Roxana, continues to work in the area of ​​administration in a state agency.  The member is part of the communal bank "Path to Progress".  The woman wishes to continue working and in this way to continue to support her family.

She needs a loan for their children's education.  The partner appreciates and values ​​the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to pay for the education of her children.

loans.name: Prudenciana

texts.es:
La socia Prudenciana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de  verduras, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia  vende cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las  verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Prudenciana still sells vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, and pumpkins.  She has been doing this for several years and things are going very well for her.  She wants to have a shop where she can sell the vegetables and is asking for this loan to buy onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma se dedica al negocio de venta de jugos,la socia prepara diferentes jugos como jugo de naranja,jugo de fresas y jugos de platanos entre otros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener su jugueria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar fresas,naranjas y platanos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Norma prepares and sells juices such as orange juice, strawberry juice, banana nectar, and others.  She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and has been doing this for seven years.  Things are going well for her and she would like to have a juice shop one day.  She is asking for this loan to buy strawberries, oranges, and bananas 

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Sarita Emely

texts.es:
Sarita de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años edad, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, estudio hasta sexto grado  debido a que sus padres no le brindaron la oportunidad de seguir estudiando. Vive junto a sus padres y sus dos hijos.

Sarita se dedica a trabajar en la artesanía en la elaboración de matates y hamacas de hilo, comenta que desde pequeña sea dedicado a esta actividad pues en su familia es su principalmente fuente de trabajo, sus padres se han dedicado a este oficio desde hace muchos años atrás. Gracias a este oficio que sabe ella, puede obtener ingresos económicos para sus dos hijos que puedan estudiar y salir adelante. Sarita también se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y también a cuidar a sus dos hijos, su jornada diaria empieza a las 5 de la mañana con los oficios domésticos y cuando termina empieza a elaborar el producto. 


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar materia prima, como hilo para trabajar.  Con ello dispondrá de hilo para elaborar los pedidos, debido a que tiene amplia demanda de sus productos; pero no tiene la suficiente materia prima para trabajar, gracias al préstamo lograra comprar sus productos y producir más y también le generara mayores  ingresos económicos para ella y su familia.

Sarita desea para el futuro poder ampliar más su negocio, desea poner un local donde pueda emplear a personas que le ayuden a realizar los trabajos, también desea construir su propia casa pues por el momento vive junto a sus padres y también desea que sus hijos sean personas de bien en la sociedad que puedan terminar sus estudios todo esto comenta que lo lograra con las ganancias y futuros créditos que solicitara.
texts.en:
Sarita is 30 years old and is the single mother of two children, ages 11 and 7.  She is a hardworking woman with a sixth grade education because her parents didn’t provide her the opportunity to continue school.  She lives with her parents and two children.

Sarita is an artist and makes mats and string hammocks.  She says that she has been doing this since she was young and this was her family’s main source of work.  Her parents have been working in this trade for many years.

Thanks to this trade, she is able to obtain an income for her two children so they can get ahead.  Sarita also does domestic work in her home and cares for her two children.  Her daily shift begins at 5:00 with her chores and when she is finished she begins making her products.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as string so she can work and be able to fill her orders, because there is ample demand for her products, so producing more provides greater income for her and her family.

Sarita wants to expand her business in the future and set up a shop where she can employ other people to help her.  She also wants to build a house of her own because she is living with her parents.  She wants her children to be persons of means in society and wants them to complete their education.  She says that she will achieve all of this with her future earnings and loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Orfa

texts.es: Doña Orfa, tiene 47 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con dos sobrinas y una hermana en un sector de Cofradía, Cortes. Ella trabajo en una empresa privada y al quedar sin empleo decidió poner su propio negocio donde vende granos básicos, lácteos, pan, huevos, jugos en lata, refrescos, dulces, churros, embutidos y otros. Este negocio lo tiene hace 3 años. Ella piensa surtir su pulpería y ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar carnes, embutidos, pan, churros, refrescos, granos básicos, productos lácteos y otros abarrotes, con el fin de aumentar la clientela. Su plan es crecer mas con el negocio ya que es su fuente de ingresos en la familia.
texts.en: Orfa is 47 years old, single, and lives with two nieces and a sister in the Cofradia, Cortes sector.  She used to work for a private company and decided to set up her own business when she became unemployed.  She sells basic grains, dairy products, bread, eggs, canned juices, soft drinks, candy, churros, sausages, and other things.  She has been doing this for three years and plans to stock her store, so she is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to buy meat, sausages, bread, churros, soft drinks, basic grains, dairy products, and other groceries so she can increase her number of customers.  Her plan is to grow her business because it’s a source of income for her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS PALOMITAS” está conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Emilia tiene 72 años de edad es viuda con hijos independientes. Ella trabaja en su quiosco en donde ofrece agua gaseosa  golosinas y frutas plátano manzana. En la afueras de su vivienda. Años atrás de dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más agua gaseosa  golosinas y frutas plátano manzana. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Emilia es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The group "Las Palomitas" (The Little Doves) consists of members who work in retail businesses and offer services.

Emilia is 72 years old. She is a widow with independent children. She works in her kiosk, where she offers carbonated water, candies, and fruits such as bananas and apples, outside of her home. Years ago she worked in her home.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more carbonated water, candies, and fruits such as bananas and apples. 

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan offered to them. Emilia is the first person seated on the right side.

loans.use: to buy carbonated water and fruit

loans.name: Adriana Del Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una joven muy amable, es de nacionalidad colombiana al igual que su esposo, pero  ya viven 6 años en Ecuador, comenta que se vinieron a Ecuador es busca de trabajo y una vida tranquila ya que en Colombia existe muchos conflictos, ella  tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 4 años, el mayor asiste a la escuela , Carmen se dedica a criar animales y pasando un día trabaja de empleada domestica en una casa, Carmen se dedica 3 años a la crianza de animales menores, ella va a invertir el dinero delo crédito en la compra de cuyes para ponerlos en una cuyera que hay en la casa que vive arrendando,  lo que aspira Carmen es quedarse viviendo en Ecuador y progresar mediante la crianza de sus animales y también aspira que sus hijos salgan adelante en sus estudios.
texts.en: Carmen is a very friendly young woman. By nationality, she is Colombian, as is her husband, but they have already lived in Ecuador for 6 years. She comments that they came to Ecuador in search of work and a peaceful life, since there are many conflicts in Colombia. She has two children, ages 3 and 4. The older one goes to school. Carmen raises animals and spends the day working as a domestic employee in a house. For three years Carmen has raised small animals. She is going to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of guinea pigs to raise in a pen at the house that they are renting. What Carmen hopes for is to remain living in Ecuador and to progress through raising her animals, and she also hopes that her children advance in their education.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 21 years old and is a student at an institute. She lives with her parents in a village in Kratie Province of Cambodia. 

Because of a lack of financial support, Chantha would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate and she will be able to find a good job. In the future, she wants to work at an institution, company or organization.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie is from Dipaculao, Aurora. He is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He wants to finish his studies and find a stable job to have a better life. 

Because they don’t have enough money for his schooling, he wants to ask for PHP 15,000 financial assistance from KIVA lenders. Jojie will study hard so this will not go to waste, and he knows that studying is one of his stepping stones towards his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Myrnalin

texts.en:
Myrnalin learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and signed up her membership in 2011. She availed several loans from the Cooperative financing her gardening activities. She plants a variety of commodities and recently she needed money for a squash plantation. She wanted to purchase vegetable seedlings.

She hopes that her farming income will increase. Myrnalin looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio has a vast area of rice land in Mahayag. His farming activities primarily supports his family. Dionesio borrowed his capital to increase his rice production. To this day, Dionesio feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business.

Recently, he borrowed a loan to pay for labor costs for rice cropping and seedbed preparations. Dionesio wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Librado

texts.en:
Librado is 54 years old and is happily married.  

Librado personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since he became a member of Paglaum MPC, he has been a member in good standing for almost three years. He wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 15,000 for the purchase of new nets for fishing. 

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. He already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. He also wants to buy the fish catch of his neighbors so he can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. He wishes to see his children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets for fishing.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda is a hardworking mother from Magsaysay, Baliangao. She has a coconut plantation and makes copra from her coconut harvest. This is how she supports her family. 

Ricarda signed up her membership with the Cooperative for the various programs and services she can enjoy. For her capitalization, she can borrow money especially for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to pay for labor cost on copra making. She hopes to have high sales so that she can renovate her house and have their fence concreted.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for copra making,

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan, a 54-year-old father of two resides in Misamis Occidental with his family. He has operated a piggery business for over six years to make a living. He needs to renovate his farm for expansion of the said business. 

Roldan borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to renovate the shelter of his piggery farm. He earns a better income from this activity and wants to have more piglets to raise and deliver in volume in the market. He wants to improve his business as well as the general living of his family.

loans.use: to renovate the shelter of his piggery farm.

loans.name: Lalin

texts.en:
Lalin is 19 years old and is a student at university. He lives with his parents in Kandal province of Cambodia. In his free time, Lalin grows vegetables to help his family. 

Because of a lack of financial support, Lalin would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to have his own business and a proper house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón De Jesús  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Sagrado Corazón De Jesús, este grupo formado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este grupo con el cual han mejorado sus negocios y su vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Rosa, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores  de edad y uno de 16 años el cual estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella tiempo atrás  aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a su familia, ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa en el cual  se dedica a confeccionar ropa de todo tipo,  confecciona ropa de mujeres y niños, en temporadas también confecciona uniformes para distintas escuelas y colegios pero de forma particular, tiene muchos clientes que llegan hasta su hogar para que les elabore sus prendas ya que ella es muy responsable y su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, lleva más de 16  años en esta labor con la cual se gana algo por el bien de la familia.
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas y cierres. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea un  gran profesional.
Las dos fotos pequeñas son de una socia y un socio que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for it’s great diversity of typical products, such as the straw hats and shawls that are well-known both locally and outside the country. The members of Grupo Crédito Sagrado Corazón de Jesús meet every 15 days. This group is comprised of 11 women and 2 men who decided awhile back to come together to create this group. With this group, they have improved their businesses and their lives.

One member of this group is Rosa. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children with her husband. Two are adults and the 16-year-old studies in school. Her husband is a storekeeper. She learned dressmaking in a local school a while back.

Doña Rosa is a very hardworking woman who likes to work for herself and to help her husband to keep the family moving forward. She has a small tailor shop in her home, where she works to sew all types of clothes. She sews women's and children's clothes. During certain seasons she also sews uniforms for different schools. She has many clients who come to her house to have their clothes made, as she is very responsible and her work is of very good quality. 

She has done this work for 16 years, and with this she earns something for the good of her family. This loan is to buy thread, fabric, and zippers. She has been with Grupo de Crédito from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are of great help. Her dreams are that her son finishes his studies and becomes a good professional. The two small photos are of male and female members who could not be present at the time the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, and zippers.

loans.name: Roseller

texts.en:
Roseller is married with one child and resides in Misamis Occidental with his family. He is a farmer and is taking care of his farm to provide for his family. He grows and harvests coconuts, bananas and grows vegetables in his backyard. He is earning daily from his farm. 

To improve and expand his vegetable garden, he borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy new seedlings and manure fertilizer. Roseller hopes to have more revenue from his farm as a result of this investment.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and manure fertilizer.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аиде 33 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование - среднее. С 1996 года стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес Аида начала с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Аида достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Аиды имеется: 2 коровы, 2 лошади и 30 овец. Также на земельной доле мерою 1,20 Га, она выращивает кукурузу и клевер. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аида обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Аида является одним из трех членов группы "Майрам". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en:
Aida is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a secondary level education.  Since 1996 she has been in farming and animal husbandry.  Aida started her business with 10,000 som (KGS) and as a result of her back-breaking work, she has been very successful in business.  Today she has a monthly profit of 20,000 som (KGS) and she owns two cows, two horses, and 30 sheep.  She also has 1.2 ha of land where she raises corn and clover.   Her husband and children help her with her business.   

Aida is one of three members of the "Mairam" group and with an aim to further developing her business, she applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy calves.  She plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the size of her herd of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves

loans.name: Bakytbek

texts.ru: Бакытбек, 49 лет, женат, есть 4 детей школьного возраста, они с радостью помогают родителям по хозяйству. У Бакытбека среднее образование и большой опыт в ведении сельскохозяйственной деятельности. В 1995 году он стал заниматься животноводством, накопив на старт сумму в 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бакытбека, на сегодняшний день у него есть 3 коровы и 3 теленка. Также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,00 Га он выращивает картофель и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бакытбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец. Бакытбек планирует расширить свой бизнес и накопить средства на постройку дома для старшего сына.
texts.en:
Bakytbek is 49 years old, married, and has four school-aged children, who happily help their parents with chores.  Bakytbek has a secondary level education and a great deal of experience in farm operations.  In 1995 he also got into animal husbandry after having saved up 6,000 som (KGS) to start.  Thanks to his hard work, today Bakytbek has three cows and three sheep. He also owns 1 ha of land where he grows potatoes and corn, both for use at home and for sale.

With an aim to further developing his business, Bakytbek applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and sheep.  Bakytbek plans to expand his business and to save up money to build a house for his eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves and sheeps

loans.name: Atirkul

texts.ru: Атиркуль 53 года, замужем, есть сын. У Атиркуль среднее образование. С 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. В хозяйстве Атиркуль есть 3 коровы, 11 овец, также на арендованном земельном участке мерою 1,50 Га она выращивает картофель и эспарцет . Также Атиркуль продает молоко местным жителям, экологически чистое и вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. Супруг Атиркуль оказывает населению строительные услуги. Ежемесячная прибыль Атиркуль составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и корма для скота.
