Атиркуль намерена увеличить поголовье породистых дойных коров и накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en:
Atirkul is 53 years old, married, and has a son.  She has a secondary level education.  Atirkul's husband is a builder.  In 1996 she started a business in farming and animal husbandry.  Her entire family helps her with the business.  Atirkul has three cows and 11 sheep.  She also rents 1.5 ha of land where she grows potatoes and sainfoin.  There is also strong demand for the environmentally friendly and delicious milk Atirkul sells to other residents of her village.  Atirkul's monthly profit comes to 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to increasing the size of her herd of cattle, Atirkul applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows and cattle feed.  Atirkul intends to increase the number of her pure-bred milk cows and to save up money to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase cows and feed for livestock

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw business for the last seven years. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Sughran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sughran is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Genere

texts.en: Genere is married and has three children. She resides in Zamboanga del Norte with her family. She has a vegetable garden in her backyard and is earning very well from this. Her previous loan that she used for buying seedlings was repaid successfully. She earns daily income from this activity that contributes much to their daily expenditures.  She took a new loan recently to purchase manure fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. In the future, Genere wants to make improvements to her house and to see her children get a better education.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer to restore farm nutrients

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mairambubu

texts.ru: Майрамбубу 63 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Майрамбубу среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже много лет занимается торговлей, полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Майрамбубу, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 30 овец и 10 лошадей. Также есть земельный надел мерою 2,10 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход Майрамбубу составляет от 15,000 сом до 20,000 сом (KGS). Майрамбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки 1 коровы и 2 лошадей. Майрамбубу намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что позволит ей накопить средства на покупку сельскохозяйственной техники.
texts.en:
Mairambubu is 63 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary level education, and, earning her family's main income, for many years she has been in the business of trade, farming, and animal husbandry.  Thanks to her perseverance, ambition, and hard work, today Mairambubu has two cows, two calves, 30 sheep, and ten horses, as well as 2.1 ha of land where she raises beans and clover.  Her monthly income is from 15,000 to 20,000 som (KGS).

Mairambubu applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow and two horses.  She plans to increase the number of her cattle, which will allow her to save up money to buy farm equipment.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and two horses in order to be more profitable and buy agricultural machinery

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is the age of 30, and she is the mother of two children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband runs a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his own household necessities from his store aswell, and some of his relatives also like to purchase from his General Store. 

He speaks with a monotonous tone which impresses people, so he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built a very good relationship with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is why his business runs well. 

Due to this good relationship his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore Najma has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

Najma's husband will utilize the loan in a positive way, and she hopes that this amount will help him to cope with their family's needs.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start building a house on the land that he owns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to look after her crops.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is the age of 27, and she is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband runs a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his own household necessities from his store aswell, and some of his relatives also like to purchase from his general store. 

His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason for his business running well. Due to his good relationship with his customers his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore Abida has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

Abida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an iron door, brackets, cement, sand and metal sheeting in order to carry out repairs to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes and to make juice

loans.name: Sira's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis décembre 2010.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même zone et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Sira en position debout et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 33 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 05 enfants dont 04 filles.

Son activité est le commerce d’œufs et de tiges de Bambou,elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.
Ainsi avec le prêt,elle compte acheter 30 tablettes d’œufs à 2200f la tablette et 120 tiges de Bambou à raison de 2500f la tige.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2010, and its members come from the same area and work in small-scale commerce. 

Sira, who is standing with her hand raised [in the photo], is the leader of the group. She is 33 years old, married, and a mother of five children, of whom four are girls. She has worked selling eggs and bamboo for several years now.

With this loan, she plans to buy 30 trays of eggs at 2,200 francs per tray and 120 rods of bamboo at 2,500 francs per rod.

Her goal is to increase her savings and support her needs.

loans.use: to buy 30 trays of eggs and 120 rods of bamboo

loans.name: Madjiguene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis décembre 2010.Il est composé de membres qui sont liés par la solidarité,elles habitent le même village.

Fatoumata qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est mariée,est âgée de 53 ans et mére d'un garçon.

Son activité est le commerce de sucre,de thé,de sucre,de la cigarette et de biscuits.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter des biscuits pour une valeur de 10000f;de la cigarette pour 10000f,du thé thé pour 10000f,du sucre pour 15000f.

Son objectif est de contribuer aux charges liées à la nourriture,renforcer son épargne et son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2010, and its members live in the same village and share ties of solidarity.

Fatoumata, who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of this group. She is married, 53 years old and is the mother of a boy. 

Fatoumata works selling sugar, tea, cigarettes, and cookies. With this loan, she plans to buy cookies for 10,000 francs, cigarettes for 10,000 francs, tea for 10,000 francs, and sugar for 15,000 francs. 

Her goal is to help support expenses related to diet and also increase her savings and business cash flow.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, tea, sugar, and cookies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Kodzo Atsu

texts.fr:
Kodzo est un homme âgé de 25 ans. Il est marié à une ménagère et avec un enfant d'un an en charge.
Kodzo travaille comme tôlier depuis. Il répare des voitures cabossées ou rouillées en changeant les tôles et les peintures à toutes les personnes désireuses, son garage se trouve à quelques mètres du site de la foire Togo 2000 à Lomé. Il achète ses approvisionnements sur place à Lomé.
Kodzo a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tôles et des peintures pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Il veut réinvestir les revenus supplémentaires de son travail dans l’achat d’un terrain. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kodzo voudrait agrandir son garage de tôlerie. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de fonder une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Kodzo is a 25-year-old man, who is married to a housewife and has one child under the age of one in his care. Kodzo has been a sheet metal worker since 2007. He repairs dented or rusty cars by replacing the sheet metal and paint for anyone who needs it. His workshop is located several meters from the site of the Togo 2000 fair in Lomé.

Kodzo buys his supplies on-site in Lomé. He is now seeking his fourth loan with WAGES in order to buy sheet metal and paint so that he can better satisfy his customers. 

He wants to reinvest any additional profits from this work into buying some land.

In the coming years, Kodzo would like to expand the size of his sheet metal garage. He says that with the profits, he plans on creating a happy family.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and paint

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi homme de 35ans est marié. Ils ont en charge un enfant de 02ans non scolarisé. Il est revendeur de poisson fumé depuis 2004 de façon ambulante. Il désire agrandir son activité qui lui procure des revenus lui permettant d'assurer son rôle de père de famille c'est pour cela il fait sa deuxième demande à WAGES afin d'acheter des marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à subvenir à ses besoins et aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Koffi is 35 years old and is married. He has a two-year-old child under his care, who does not go to school. 

Koffi has been selling smoked fish by traveling around since 2004. He wishes to expand his business so that he can earn enough to assure his role as father of the family. It is for this reason that he is seeking a second loan with WAGES, so that the can buy more goods.

Profits will help him support his and his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Messanvi

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 30ans, Messanvi est marié et papa de 02 enfants. Il est blanchisseur de profession depuis 2008. Il souhaite financer son activité avec ce second crédit qu'il demande à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et rendre durable son activité.
texts.en:
A young man of 30 years, Messanvi is married and a father of two children. He has been a launder since 2008.

He wishes to finance his business with a second loan, which he is seeking through WAGES. 

Profits will allow him to improve his family's living conditions and make his business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and detergent

loans.name: Thioro's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2007.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,ils sont liés par la solidarité.Elles ont comme activité l'exploitation agricole dans les plantations de bananes.

Haby qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est mariée et mére de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Son activité consiste à planter de la banane et de les revendre au bout de 06 mois.

Ainsi avec son crédit,elle compte acheter du fumier pour 140000f,de l'engrais pour 225000f,de la paille pour 40000f et du frais de transport 40000f.

Son objectif est de s'assurer ses besoins familiaux tels que la scolarité,la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2007 and is composed of members who live in the same village and share ties of solidarity. They all work as farmers on banana plantations.

Haby, who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower [of this group]. She is married and a mother of five children, of whom two are boys.

Haby works planting bananas and selling them after about six months. With this loan, she plans to buy manure for 140,000 francs, fertilizer for 225,000 francs, and straw for 40,000 francs. She will also pay the cost of transport which is about 40,000 francs.

Her goal is to support her family's needs, especially school, health, and diet.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and straw

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa  es una señora muy alegre, ella nunca se caso ni tampoco tuvo hijos, los únicos que le acompañan son unos perritos a los que los quiere mucho, Rosa  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores  desde que tenía 12 años de edad ya que su madre le enseñaba a esta actividad, Rosa necesita el crédito para comprar chanchos, ya que esa es  su fuente de ingreso, lo que ella aspira  comprarse otra chancha grande para tenerla de reproductora y comercializar los chanchitos y de ahí cubrir los gastos de alimento, salud y vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very happy lady, she never married nor had children, and the only ones she lives with are her little dogs that she loves.
Rosa has been working and raising small animals since she was 12 years old and her mother taught her how to do it.
Rosa needs a loan to buy pigs, because that is their source of income. She aspires to buy another big sow to the breed and market piglets and then cover the cost of her food, health and housing.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilzers.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is  a 30-year-old  mother of two who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

She runs a General Store to sell rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. She meets the household expenses from her own store as well.  Her relatives like to purchase from her General Store.  She speaks with an impressive calm voice and easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to her behavior and personality, she has built very good relationships with her customers. Her general store is very famous in the town and her business runs well. 

Her sales have increased a lot but she does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Kousar requested a loan to  buy  wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergent, and biscuits.
 
Kousar thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her  general store.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is 58 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is happily married and has one school-aged child. 

He has had a poultry business raising eggs for 15 years. He earns 20,000 PHP per month. He requests 40,000.00 PHP to purchase feed for his laying hens. 

Isidro has been a member of PMPC since 2012. He hopes to have a big amount of savings for his child and  business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase feed for  hens.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma  is 51 years old, married, and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She raises pigs for a living.   

She obtained the capital from  Paglaum PC to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan to buy additional feed. 

She  hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to provide more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed.

loans.name: Maria Luceny

texts.es: María es una señora trabajadora, está casada y tiene 3 hijos  que se encuentran estudiando, ella  juntamente con su esposo se dedican a trabajar al jornal, María es una señora colombiana que vive en Ecuador desde hace 17 años ya que dejo su país natal para buscar trabajo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio y salir adelante con sus hijos, María aspira mejorar su negocio para  ayudarse en  los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is a hardworking lady. She is married and has 3 children who are studying. Maria and her husband work daily. She is a Colombian woman who has been living in Ecuador for 17 years since she left her native country to seek work. The loan is going to be invested in the purchase of pigs to improve their business and support their children. Maria aims to improve her business to help with her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine makes a living from  gardening.  She is 29, married, and provides for the family. 

She sells a variety of flowers in the local community. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. Belonging to the cooperative has provided her with the capital needed to support her gardening business. She applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. 

In the future, Geraldine wishes to supply flowers to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 37-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two and maintains her house hold activities properly. 

She has run a beauty salon for the last few years as a good trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day. She needs additional products such as  facial cream, combs,  chairs, and mirrors to meet the demand. 

Bushra contacted Kiva's  field partner BRAC Pakistan.   BRAC  staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan. 

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to expand her  beauty saloon business.

loans.name: Martin Enrique

texts.es:
Martin es un joven emprendedor, padre de familia de una maravillosa niña, trabaja como cocinero en un restaurante de su ciudad natal, Tate. El motor de su vida es su hija, por ella lucha día y noche porque quiere brindarle todo lo mejor y que no le falte nada.
Martin quiere seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su pequeña, por ello utilizará el crédito para poder comprar un juego de dormitorio para su hija para que tenga mayor comodidad. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque su apoyo contribuirá a que su hija tenga mayor bienestar porque para Martin su pequeña es el centro de su universo y todo lo que hace es por su mejoría.
texts.en:
Martin is a young entrepreneur and the father of a wonderful little girl. He works as a chef in a restaurant in his hometown, Tate. The motivation in his life is his daughter and he struggles day and night to give her the best and not have her miss out on anything.
Martin hopes to improve his daughter's quality of life and so will use the loan to buy her a bedroom set so she has some comforts. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity because their support will help his daughter to have a better well-being as she is the centre of his universe and everything he does is for her.

loans.use: to buy a bedroom set for his daughter.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns a clothing  business which is the only source of income for the family. He needs additional capital to grow his business.  Nazeeran  requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. The inventory will help him to  respond quickly to customer needs and  save money to pay electricity and gas bills. 

Nazeeran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's clothes  business.

loans.name: Puthy

texts.en:
Puthy is a 29-year-old married woman with a small child.  She works in a garment factory and lives in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. 

She has been a factory worker since 2010. Her husband is 26 years old and  also works in the factory. Both of them can earn approximately $10 a day. 

Puthy would like to request a loan to buy a cow to breed. This loan will help her to earn more income. 

In the future, she is going to have a new house with fences  and provide her child with a high school education.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es: Juana de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se esfuerza por salir adelante al lado de su familia apoyada en su pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad, la cual posee desde hace 7 años en su domicilio. Juana desea realizar mejoras en su vivienda, desea construir una pared  para cerrar la parte del portón y dejar solo una ventana para atender a los clientes. Además, desea cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de ésta área, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, lamina y madera para realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Agradece el apoyo recibido en el pasado, de esta forma va mejorando su vivienda de forma progresiva.
texts.en:
Juana, 27, lives in her own house with her husband and 10 year old daughter. She is a working woman who strives to succeed and who has supported her family through her little staples store, which she has been running for 7 years in her home.
Juana wants to make improvements in her home, building a wall to close over the door and only leaving a window space to serve her customers. She also wants to change the ceiling and cement the floor of this area, this is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan; to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron sheets and wood for home improvements. She is grateful for the support she has received in the past and will continue to improve her home progressively.

loans.use: To buy: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron sheets and wood to build a wall, ceiling and to improve the concrete settings around her home.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 56 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has four children. 

Leonida and her husband sell her vegetables harvest.  She requests a loan to purchase vegetable seedlings and 1 sack of fertilizer. 

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Leonida hopes that her children will finish their studies and have stable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and 1 sack of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 44 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow and has a child. 

She has had a snack vending business for 3 years and requests 5,000.00 PHP to buy items and ingredients. 

Maria Fe has been a member of PMPC since 2012.

loans.use: to buy items and ingredients.

loans.name: Soeut

texts.en: Soeut is a 38-year-old garment-factory worker and a married woman with two children living in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been a worker since 2013. One of her children is also a garment-factory worker and another is a student. Her husband is 41, and is an ice cream seller. Together, they can earn approximately $15 daily. Now Soeut would like to request a loan to buy zinc sheets to renovate her house. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to support her children to pursue bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Simon who describes himself as ambitious.  He is sixty-four years old, married and blessed with four children. He farms vegetables such as cabbages, kale and potatoes. He requests a loan to buy fertilizer to enhance the yield of his farm. He hopes for a bountiful harvest, thus more income. He will use the anticipated income to cater to his family's needs.
 Simon is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 57-year-old woman with three children who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She has to look after her family at home.

Her husband owns a medical clinic to provide first aid services to his patients. He was trained by a professional MBBS doctor.   He owns his own small clinic to treat patients and assist them to recover. He has become very famous in the society. He wants to establish his clinic with the  latest medical instruments, medicines, injections, and glucose, but he does not have enough capital.

Therefore, Kalsoom requests a loan for her husband to purchase  medicines so that he could earn maximum profit. 

Kalsoom thanks Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy medical instruments, medicine, injections, and glucose  for her husband's clinic.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 42 years old and lives in Sepac Sapang dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married and  has five children. 

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 9 years and has raised hogs for 3 yrs. She requests a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase additional bags of feed. 

In the future, Mila hopes to build a concrete pig cage to provide more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of feed.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 50-year-old widow. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family and her son works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her son owns a clothing sales business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For this Razia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her son to purchase variety of clothes to sell. So that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit he will put aside some savings to pay for the electricity and gas bills. Razia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her son's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to grow her son's clothing sales business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
In 2011, Lina learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-up businesses. As a farmer in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Lina feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 
Recently, Lina took out a loan to buy more farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, 39, is a mother of three children. Her son owns a tailoring shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring items for the shop, including thread, needles, and material. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. Due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to purchase these items. 

Rukhsana is requests a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son buy a new sewing machine. 

Rukhsana is  happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan. She is thankful to Kava lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her son's tailoring work.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 39-year-old woman with five children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her brother is a professional rickshaw driver. His rickshaw is not working properly and he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to repair the rickshaw. Therefore, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her brother repair the rickshaw and continue his business.

 Asia thanksKiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her brother's rickshaw.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia has agricultural land in Tudela and grows rice and a variety of crops.  She earns a good income doing this type of work. She wants to expand her business and would like to buy a parcel of land to plant grow vegetables. She requests 50,000 PHP through Paglaum MPC. 

Virgenia hopes to be a vegetable supplier in the local community and  buy a truck to easily deliver vegetables  to the market.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of land.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is twenty three years old, married, and blessed with one child. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern  Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her business management knowledge.  

Janeth operates a kiosk to sell flour, sugar, cooking fat, milk, and other household items. She will use the loan to increase her stock  and hopes this will improve her supply and increase her income. She will be in a position to meet her family's needs for food and clothing.

Janeth is grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, cooking fat, and milk.

loans.name: Cupriana

texts.en:
Retailing helped  Cupriana's family to survive. She buys and sells bananas and finds the business to be easy and simple .  

Cupriana plans to expand her retail business and applied for a loan to PMPC. She wants to purchase  bananas.  

Cupriana smiles as she thinks about seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase  bananas for retail.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 36 years old and married with three children aged between nine years and three months. Her two older children go to school. She has had a business selling electricity for the past five years. With this loan, Claudine would like to buy more electricity to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest in the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more electricity to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 42-year-old married women with three children. Her husband is a government employee. 

She has started a business to sell clothing to support her family. She purchase a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profit in the main market. 

She needs to purchase some clothes to sell but does not have the funds. She requests a loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. Sofia is thankful to Kiva's lenders.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Imani Bagaria Location Poutry Keeping Shg Group

texts.en:
Eunice is the person raising her hand in the photo. She is a member of Imani Bagaria location poultry keeping Self Help Group. She is forty six years old, married and  blessed with six children. She grows maize, beans and practices dairy farming.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to gain enterprise development and financial management skills. This has helped her to manage her business well.

She is borrowing money to buy fertilizer and dairy feed. This will improve her crop yield, dairy milk production, and enable her to earn more income. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and also buy for them clothes.

She hopes that the Kiva loan will improve her living standards. She is very grateful to Kiva and their lender's help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and dairy feed.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is from Siquijor, Philippines. She is married and has adult-age children. 

She has sold soap, lotion and other products to her neighbors, schools, and offices for 10 years.  This business has helped her a lot in meeting family needs. She requests a loan to  buy bulk quantities of inventory items. 

In the future, she wants to own a shop where she can display her stock and serve customers  from her neighborhood and neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy  lotion, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Cecilia. She is married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training they run on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her skills in business management.

Cecilia sells liquid petroleum gas and she needs a loan to add to her stock. This will ensure she meets the rising demands of her customers. She hopes the level of her income will increase and she will be in a position to continue supporting her family. 

Cecelia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of liquid petroleum gas.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 48-year-old woman with 9 children who works hard to support her family. 

She is a grows vegetables and is a dairy farmer. She requests a loan to buy dairy 
feed and high quality cabbage seeds  to improve both the cows milk production and crop yield. 

She anticipates an increase in income which will help meet her family's needs such as food, clothing, education and shelter.

Margret is very happy for Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed and seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria makes a living through her retailing business. She buys lumber for resale in the market and earns a promising income to support her family. 

She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed a loan to purchase more lumber to sell. 

Maria hopes to sustain her business and dreams of living a decent and happy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber for her to sell

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 33-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family which consists of three children as well. Her husband has been running a restaurant for the last seven years. He provides services to the people, serving good and fresh food. His restaurant is situated in the main market. Many shopkeepers come to his restaurant to eat delicious food. 

He needs some crockery and fresh food items to enhance his business. In this regard Abida contacted Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for a loan. BRAC issued a loan to Abida for the development of her husband's business. 

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's restaurant business.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business.

Gabriela has maintained her membership in good standing and with no default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Gabriela wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is a married man with three children. He sells foods in their village with the help of his wife to make a living. Aside from this, he is operating their own farm, it is their main source of income. With these activities, he was able to provide for his family and had repaid successfully his previous loan used for his food-vending business. 

To improve his farm, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase manure fertilizer and more variety of seedlings for his vegetable garden. He is hopeful to have a greener farm and wants to improve the general living standard of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer and more variety of seedlings for his vegetable garden.

loans.name: Luzma

texts.en:
Luzma is a businesswoman from Tudela. She is 45 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that just supports her family. 

Luzma is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any record of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Luzma continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Wanyanjo Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photograph is Esther; she is a member of Wanyanjo Women Group. She is twenty-eight years old, a single mother blessed with three children. She earns her living by running a tailoring business. 

She is applying for a loan to add more stock of sewing thread and textile fabric. She will be in a position to meet her customers' rising demand which will thereafter translate to improved income. This will help her support her children's education by buying studying materials and paying tuition fees. 

She is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sewing thread and textile fabric.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Peter has been working hard to manage his phone accessories business, where he sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phone accessories, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and open up another branch. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials, threads and a second machine.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is 31 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Collins has been working hard to manage his hardware shop, where he sells hardware items. 

To help expand his business, Collins has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more house paint, iron sheets and cement to sell, and will help Collins to generate greater profits and complete his house. Collins hopes that in the future he will be able to expand it into a wholesale shop. 

Collins is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Collins who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more house paint, iron sheets and cement to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She gets her financing needs from the Cooperative, especially for her business.  

She primarily supports her family through her farming activities, and is able to send her children to school. Recently, she bought riceland and wants to cultivate it for rice farming. 

She approached Paglaum for a loan to pay for seedlings and fertilizer.  She deeply wishes this will help give her farming income a big boost. 

Lorena looks for better business opportunities, and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Siraje

texts.en:
Siraje is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke, in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children; two of them are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Siraje has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells sacks of produce. 

To help expand his business, Siraje has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Siraje to generate greater profits and raise income. Siraje hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his stock. 

Siraje is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Siraje who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a farmer from Mahayag and a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. 
 
PMPC came as a rescuer for Beatriz by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now she availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. 

She borrowed an amount to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers. Beatriz perseveres and always believes she will reach her goals so she will be continuously able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 74 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with giving her capital to support her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers. In the future,  Lourdes wishes to become the supplier of rice for sale in her area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Mesaidi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mesaidi operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal and firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 28-year-old single man. He is an educated man with secondary-level education, living in his family's house in Taiz, Yemen. He lives with his family in a very miserable conditions in an old and very small house. All the members of the family suffer from these condition and they can't afford that. 

The father is the breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. Sami helps him in that responsibility. He is a very active and dynamic young man. He works hard in order to improve the living standards of his family and wants to expand his house more through building other rooms and a large kitchen. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. 

For this reason, Sami applied for a Youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials as cement, bricks, and iron steel to  build other rooms to expand his family's house. 

Sami hopes to provide his family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron steel.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with one of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Nuru has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, where she sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Nuru has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts like oil, and will help Nuru to generate greater profits. Nuru hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her land. 

Nuru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nuru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like oil.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en:
Ignatius is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Ignatius has been working hard to manage his produce business, where he sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Ignatius has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of produce, and will help Ignatius to generate greater profits and expand the business. Ignatius hopes that in the future he will be able to have more stock. 

Ignatius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ignatius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of produce.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia, 49 years old, is married and a resident of Alegria, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn, root crops and even trees. Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing copra in bulk from neighbors for resale at market. 

Last April, 2008, both Cresencia and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail a loan because they wanted to increase their resources to cater to more customers for added income. She has now applied for a loan of 8,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy her more kilos of copra for resale. 

She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the support of her family, she would become a successful businesswoman who sufficiently provides for her family and extends help to the needy.

loans.use: to buy her more kilos of copra for selling

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 44 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past year, Nathan has been working hard to manage his produce business, where he sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Nathan has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of produce, and will help Nathan to generate greater profits and buy more stock. Nathan hopes that in the future he will be able to expand on the business. 

Nathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of produce.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 7 children with 6 of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her boutique, where she sells new clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more types of clothes to sell, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and cover some home basic needs. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to become a rich entrepreneur and business woman. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mubaraka

texts.en:
Mubaraka is 29 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Mubaraka has been working hard to manage his tire sale business, which sells old tires. 

To help expand his business, Mubaraka has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tires, and will help Mubaraka to generate greater profits and add stock. Mubaraka hopes that in the future he will be able to expand on the business. 

Mubaraka is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mubaraka who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more tires

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from two to six years. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be a distributor of fish within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.en:
In 2012, Ponciano learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and he immediately signed up for his membership. 

He has a rice land in Tudela, where he earns well with his farming activities. 

Recently he applied a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. He wanted to increase his sales this cropping season, as he has children to support for their education. 

Ponciano smiles at the thought of seeing all his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be industrious. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea, and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal and poultry feed. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy animal and poultry feed

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 48 years old and a resident of Dumingag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with five children. She has a business where she sells vegetables and corn. She has had this business for 20 years. 

She joined PMPC to sustain her business and provide vegetables and corn to the consumers. She requested a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to pay for labor costs and vegetable seedlings. In the future she hopes to have their own multicab to be used for delivering the vegetables in the market.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as humble and kind. She operates a retail business where she sells trousers, dresses, blouses etc. She has been involved in this business for 23 years. 

Her business is located in urban market area and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to buy more stock. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to employ more staff within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her eighth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is of the age of 42, a mother of four children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is very hardworking, gracious and honest person. Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods two times in a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning good profit from this restaurant business. She helps her husband by cooking various foods at home and her husband sells it in his restaurant. He offers tea to his customers also. Now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron etc. Due to household expenses his savings are not enough to buy the desired things.

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron etc. She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support it gives her.

loans.use: to buy new plastic furniture, utensils and a cauldron for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 46 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 4 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bails of clothes, and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and expand on stock. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to add the business. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehema who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as self-motivated. She operates a food stall where she cooks mandazi (coconut doughnut) to sell. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients to prepare mandazi. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her bills.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients to prepare mandazi.

loans.name: Azizi

texts.en:
Azizi is 33 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Azizi has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells bread, sugar, soap, water, cooking oil, soda, beer, tea leaves. 

To help expand his business, Azizi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bread, sugar, soap, water, cooking oil, soda, beer, tea leaves, and will help Azizi to generate greater profits and buy plot of land. Azizi hopes that in the future he will be able to build rentals. 

Azizi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Azizi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase bread, sugar, soap, water, cooking oil, soda, beer, tea leaves.
